A Representative B^Gli1^I ZF / DNA structure extrapolated from MD trajectories . B^Gli1^I ZF is shown as B^blue^I cartoon , residues involved in binding to DNA ( based on single point mutation study ) are shown as magenta sticks , and Zn ions as gray spheres . 
B Effect of B^Gli1^I ZF mutants on the binding affinity to DNA as predicted by in silico alanine scanning . The ∆∆G B^was^I calculated along MD trajectories as the difference between the ∆G of each Gli1ZF alanine mutant and B^Gli1^I ZF‐WT . Results are shown as ∆∆G values in kcal / B^mol^I calculated by means of the MM‐PBSA methods ± SEM . 
C Effect of B^Gli1^I ZF mutants on B^Gli1^I ‐dependent transcriptional activation . B^Luciferase^I assay B^was^I performed in HEK293T cells transfected B^with^I 12X B^Gli^I BS‐ Luc ( GliBS , B^Gli^I binding site ) , pRL‐TK Renilla ( normalization control ) , Flag ‐ B^Gli1^I WT or the indicated Flag ‐ B^Gli1^I mutants . Data show the mean ± B^SD^I of three independent experiments . * P 0 . 01 ; * * P 0 . 05 versus B^Gli1^I WT . Western B^blot^I analysis of Flag ‐ B^Gli1^I WT or the indicated Flag ‐ B^Gli1^I mutant expression levels ( bottom panel ) . 
E B^Gli1^I / DNA binding . Double‐stranded oligonucleotide containing the canonical GliBS sequence ( 5′ - TTGCCTACCTGGGTGGTCTCTCCACTT - 3′ ) or mutated GliBS sequence used as control ( 5′ - TTGCCTACCTCCCACTTCTCTCCACTT - 3′ ) B^was^I used as probe ( P ) in EMSA experiments . The assay B^was^I performed using recombinant B^GST^I ‐ B^Gli1^I ZF‐WT ( B^Gli1^I zinc finger fragment : aa 242 - 424 ) , B^GST^I ‐ B^Gli1^I ZF‐K350A and B^GST^I ‐ B^Gli1^I ZF‐K340A . The graph on the right indicates ratio ( mean arbitrary units ± B^SD^I from three independent experiments ) of B^GST^I ‐ B^Gli1^I ZF‐WT or B^GST^I ‐ B^Gli1^I ZF mutants bound to the labeled GliBS probe / GliBS‐free probe normalized to the amount of B^GST^I ‐ B^Gli1^I ZF‐WT / DNA binding ( as described in ) . * P 0 . 05 versus B^Gli1^I WT .

Treatment time B^was^I 24 h , and control cells were treated B^with^I DMSO only .

B^Pfkfb3^I gene B^was^I used as a negative control .

H Quantification of B^EGFR^I and p AKT levels from the Western B^blot^I in ( G ) ( mean ± B^SD^I ; n = 5 ) . 
I The PY motif mutant B^LAPTM4B^I ‐2PA loses interaction B^with^I B^Nedd4^I B^but^I keeps interaction B^with^I B^Hrs^I in HEK293 cells cotransfected B^with^I the indicated proteins . 
J The effects of B^LAPTM4B^I ‐2PA mutant overexpression on B^EGF^I ‐stimulated B^EGFR^I degradation and signaling . Overexpression of Flag ‐ B^LAPTM4B^I ‐WT or 2PA mutant overexpression B^was^I accomplished by lentivirus‐mediated infection approach . Cells B^with^I high expression of Flag ‐ B^LAPTM4B^I were selected as polyclonal pools B^for^I comparison . Cells were starved and stimulated B^with^I 100 ng / ml B^EGF^I B^for^I the indicated time periods , and whole‐cell lysates were analyzed by Western B^blot^I . K Quantification of B^EGFR^I degradation from Western B^blot^I in ( J ) ( mean ± B^SD^I ; n = 3 ) . 
A - C Co‐immunoprecipitation ( co‐IP ) of wild‐type ( WT ) or C‐terminal deletion mutants of B^HA^I ‐ PIPKIγi5 B^with^I B^SNX5^I ( A ) or B^LAPTM4B^I ( B and C ) in HEK293 cells cotransfected B^with^I indicated proteins . Δ675 indicates a deletion from amino acid 675 to the C‐terminus . 
D PIPKIγi5 promotes B^SNX5^I association B^with^I B^LAPTM4B^I . HEK293 cells cotransfected B^with^I indicated proteins were harvested B^for^I co‐IP to assay the interaction between B^Myc^I ‐ B^SNX5^I and Flag ‐ B^LAPTM4B^I . 
E B^SNX5^I inhibits B^Hrs^I association B^with^I B^LAPTM4B^I . HEK293 cells cotransfected B^with^I indicated proteins were harvested B^for^I co‐IP to assay the interaction between B^Myc^I ‐ B^Hrs^I and Flag ‐ B^LAPTM4B^I . 
A Electron microscopy analyses to see autophagic bodies in the vacuoles under both growth and nitrogen starvation conditions . Autophagic bodies typically contain cytosolic ribosomes . B^pep4^I ∆ B^prb1^I ∆ and B^pep4^I ∆ B^prb1^I ∆ B^atg2^I ∆ cells were grown in B^SD^I to mid‐log phase ( OD600 = 1 ) and transferred to B^SD^I ( ‐N ) B^for^I 5 h . B - D Time‐dependent changes in nucleoside contents under nitrogen starvation ( B ) , rapamycin treatment ( C ) , and carbon starvation ( D ) conditions . Wild‐type and B^atg2^I Δ cells were grown in B^SD^I and transferred to B^SD^I ( ‐N ) , B^SD^I medium B^with^I 0 . 2 μM rapamycin , or B^SD^I ( ‐C ) at time 0 . At the indicated time points , nucleosides were analyzed by LC / B^MS^I as described in . Results are presented as normalized intensities on the basis of peak height of each metabolite in wild‐type cells . All data are means of triplicate samples . The error bars represent the standard deviation .

C Gene expression heatmaps of selected genes from the bound and activated and bound and repressed groups show activation of B^key^I hematopoietic target genes and repression of B^key^I cardiac target genes in B^Scl^I ‐expressing mesoderm as compared to B^Scl^I ‐deficient mesoderm . Control [ B^Scl^I + / hCD4 , divided into B^Scl^I ‐expressing ( B^Scl^I + ) and non‐expressing cells ( B^Scl^I − ) ] and B^Scl^I KOEBs are shown . 
D B^Scl^I and control IgGChIP‐seq tracks show examples of B^Scl^I binding sites near hematopoietic ( B^Runx1^I and B^Gata2^I ) and cardiac ( B^Gata4^I and B^Gata6^I ) genes in Flk1 + mesoderm ( MES ) . 
E Verification of B^Scl^I binding sites marked B^with^I asterisks in ( D ) using ChIP‐PCR , average enrichment of at least three independent biological experiments over negative control region ( chr16 : 92230219 - 92230338 ) B^with^I SEM are shown . 
F Verification of B^Scl^I ‐dependent gene expression using qRT - B^PCR^I . Average of three biological replicates B^with^I B^SD^I are shown . 
H Heatmaps show B^Scl^I binding to majority of activated hematopoietic and repressed cardiac transcription factors and other proteins . See also Supplementary Fig S1 and Supplementary Table B^S1A^I - E . 
A Distribution of B^Scl^I binding sites relative to B^TSS^I in B^Scl^I ‐bound activated or repressed genes shows that majority of B^Scl^I binding sites locate away from B^TSS^I . Chi‐square test B^was^I used to assess differences in the distribution . 
B Percent of tissue‐specific enhancers validated by B^LacZ^I reporter mice ( Vista enhancer browser ) that overlap B^with^I B^Scl^I MES binding sites shows that B^Scl^I binds to experimentally verified heart enhancers more often compared to enhancers from other tissues . 
C Percent of B^Scl^I MES binding sites that overlap B^with^I heart enhancers in B^E11^I . 5 embryos defined by B^p300^I binding ( Blow et al , ) is higher than overlap B^with^I enhancers from other tissues . 
D B^Scl^I MES binding sites overlap B^with^I experimentally verified heart‐specific enhancers upstream of B^Myocardin^I and Nkx2 . 5 genes and B^with^I hematopoietic enhancers within B^Runx1^I and B^Gata2^I genes . 
E Percent of enhancers from different cardiac developmental stages identified by B^H3^I K4me1 ( enhancers ) and B^H3^I K4me1 combined B^with^I B^H3^I k27ac ( active enhancers ) ( Wamstad et al , ) that overlap B^with^I B^Scl^I MES binding sites . 
F Average B^H3^I K4me1 ( left ) and B^H3^I K27ac ( right ) profiles around all 4 , 393 B^Scl^I binding sites show tissue‐specific enrichment in Flk1 + mesoderm ( MES ) , cardiac precursors ( B^CP^I ) and cardiomyocytes ( B^CM^I ) B^but^I B^not^I in B^ESC^I ( mouseES cells ) mouse embryonic fibroblasts ( MEF ) and embryonic limbs ( LIMB ) . 
G Correlation analysis of B^H3^I K4me1 ( left ) and B^H3^I K27ac ( right ) levels between WT and B^Scl^I KOMES and ES cells and MES ( Wamstad et al , ) around 4 , 393 B^Scl^I binding sites shows that establishment of these marks occurs independently of B^Scl^I . 
H B^Scl^I , B^H3^I K4me1 and B^H3^I K27ac ChIP‐seq tracks show comparable levels of B^H3^I K4me1 and B^H3^I K27ac in WT and B^Scl^I KO mesoderm around cardiac ( B^Gata6^I , B^Tbx5^I ) and hematopoietic ( Eto2 , B^Gfi1b^I ) genes . 
C ChIP‐seq tracks B^with^I B^Scl^I binding in Flk1 + MES , B^HPC7^I , FL erythroblasts and MEL ( mouse erythroleukemia cells ) around cardiac ( B^Gata4^I , B^Myocd^I , Nkx2 . 5 ) and hematopoietic ( B^Gata1^I , B^Gata2^I and B^Lyl1^I ) genes show that binding to cardiac genes occurs only in mesoderm , while binding to hematopoietic genes is maintained throughout hematopoietic development . 
D Comparison of the location of developmental stage‐specific B^Scl^I binding sites relative to B^TSS^I shows that B^Scl^I binding near B^TSS^I occurs more often in later hematopoietic development compared to mesoderm . 
E Heatmaps of combinatorial clustering of B^H3^I K4me1 around B^Scl^I mesodermal binding sites in MES , B^HPC7^I and MEL reveal two major clusters : Cluster L loses B^H3^I K4me1 , H3K27ac and B^Scl^I binding during hematopoietic differentiation and is enriched B^for^I genes involved in heart development ; cluster R retains B^H3^I K4me1 , B^H3^I K27ac and B^Scl^I binding during hematopoietic differentiation and is enriched B^for^I hematopoiesis‐related genes . Selected B^GO^I terms among B^top^I 10 most enriched are shown . 
A Heatmaps of B^H3^I K4me1 , B^H3^I K27ac , B^H3^I K27me3 and B^H3^I K9me3 histone modifications in FL erythroblasts around B^Scl^I MES binding sites in cluster L and cluster R show no gain of common repressive histone marks in cluster L . 
B B^H3^I K27me3 ChIP‐seq tracks in ES cells ( B^ESC^I ) , Flk1 + mesoderm ( MES ) and FL erythroblasts ( Ery ) show that cardiac genes B^Gata6^I , B^Tbx5^I and B^Gata4^I harbor B^H3^I K27me3 at the B^TSS^I ( pink ) B^but^I B^not^I at B^Scl^I binding sites ( gray ) . 
C Average B^H3^I K27me3 ( left ) and B^H3^I K27ac ( right ) levels in FL erythroblasts around the B^TSS^I of B^extended^I list of B^Scl^I activated and repressed genes show that B^Scl^I repressed genes have on average more B^H3^I K27me3 and less B^H3^I K27ac as compared to B^Scl^I activated genes . 
D B^Ezh2^I ChIP‐seq tracks in WT and B^Scl^I KO mesoderm showing that B^Ezh2^I recruitment to the B^TSS^I of cardiac genes B^Gata6^I , B^Tbx5^I and B^Gata4^I is B^not^I B^Scl^I dependent . 
E Average B^Ezh2^I enrichment in WT ( left ) and B^Scl^I KOmesoderm ( right ) B^for^I inactive enhancers ( defined by having B^H3^I K4me1 and B^H3^I K27me3 modifications ( Wamstad et al , ) and distance greater than 5 kb from B^TSS^I ) and B^for^I B^Scl^I binding sites shows no B^Ezh2^I enrichment at B^Scl^I binding sites . 
F Average B^Ezh2^I enrichment at the B^TSS^I of B^extended^I list of B^Scl^I activated and repressed genes is similar in WT ( left ) and B^Scl^I KOmesoderm ( right ) . 
G Heatmaps of Lsd1 enrichment in ES cells , WT and B^Scl^I KOmesoderm and in granulocytes ( Gr ) ( Kerenyi et al , ) in cluster L and cluster R show co‐localization of Lsd1 binding B^with^I B^Scl^I binding sites and reveal that recruitment of Lsd1 B^can^I happen independently of B^Scl^I . 
H Lsd1 ChIP‐seq tracks ( ES cells , WT and B^Scl^I KO Flk1 + mesoderm and granulocytes ) and H3K4me1 ChIP‐seq track ( granulocytes ) show that Lsd1 enrichment coincides B^with^I SclMES binding sites nearby cardiac genes B^Gata6^I and B^Myocd^I in WT and B^Scl^I KO Flk1 + mesoderm . 
C B^Gata4^I , B^Hand1^I and B^Scl^I ChIP‐seq tracks B^with^I cardiac and hematopoietic gene regions show examples of three subgroups of enhancers - those bound by B^Scl^I , B^Hand1^I and B^Gata4^I ( gray ) , B^Scl^I and B^Gata4^I ( orange ) and those bound only by B^Scl^I ( B^blue^I ) . 
D - H B^Scl^I binding sites that overlap B^with^I both B^Hand1^I and B^Gata4^I ( gray ) or B^with^I B^Hand1^I ( green ) or Gata 4 ( orange ) alone show higher evolutionary conservation ( D ) and higher average enrichment of B^Scl^I ( E ) , B^H3^I K4me1 ( F ) , B^H3^I K27ac ( G ) and Lsd1 ( H ) in mesoderm compared to sites bound by B^Scl^I alone ( B^blue^I ) . 
I Average expression changes between B^Scl^I ‐expressing and B^Scl^I ‐deficient mesoderm shows that genes that are regulated by enhancers bound by all three ( B^Scl^I , B^Hand1^I and B^Gata4^I ) factors or two factors ( B^Scl^I and B^Hand1^I or B^Scl^I and B^Gata4^I ) show higher absolute expression changes compared to those bound by B^Scl^I alone . 
J Analysis of B^Scl^I ‐regulated B^key^I hematopoietic and cardiac genes shows that many of them B^can^I be bound also by cardiac factors , B^Scl^I , B^Gata4^I and B^Hand1^I ( orange ) ; B^Scl^I and B^Hand1^I binding ( green ) ; B^Scl^I and B^Gata4^I binding ( orange ) ; and B^Scl^I binding alone ( B^blue^I ) . 
A B^FACS^I analysis of day 7 EBs B^with^I markers B^CD41^I and c‐Kit shows efficient generation of HSPCs from WT , B^but^I B^not^I B^Scl^I KO or B^Gata1^I , 2KO cells . Average of six independent experiments B^with^I SEM is shown . 
B B^FACS^I analysis of day 5 . 25 EBs B^with^I markers B^CD41^I , Flk1 , Tie2 and B^CD31^I shows the generation of hemogenic endothelial cells from WT and B^Gata1^I , 2KO cells , B^but^I B^not^I B^Scl^I KO cells . Average of five independent biological experiments B^with^I SEM is shown . 
C Assessment of the developmental potential of day 4 . 75 EB B^CD41^I − B^CD31^I + Tie2 + endothelial cells on OP9 B^for^I 14 days shows the generation of B^CD45^I + hematopoietic cells from WT cells B^but^I B^not^I B^Gata1^I , 2KO or B^Scl^I KO cells , and troponin T + cardiomyocytes from B^Scl^I KO cells , B^but^I B^not^I WT or B^Gata1^I , 2KO cells . Average of four independent experiments B^with^I SEM is shown . 
D Heatmaps show gene expression differences in subsets of hematopoietic genes between B^Gata1^I , 2KO and WT or B^Scl^I KO day 4 . 75 B^CD41^I − B^CD31^I + Tie2 + endothelial cells . Cardiac derepression is observed only in B^Scl^I KO cells . * designates non‐functional transcripts . 
B - D B^Scl^I ChIP‐seq tracks in WT and B^Gata1^I , 2KO Flk1 + MES show B^Gata1^I ‐ and 2‐independent B^Scl^I binding to cardiac regulators ( B^Myocardin^I , B^Gata4^I ) ( B ) . 
B - D B^Scl^I ChIP‐seq tracks in WT and B^Gata1^I , 2KO Flk1 + MES show B^Gata1^I ‐ and 2‐independent B^Scl^I binding to B^Gata1^I ‐ and 2‐independent B^Scl^I binding to B^key^I hemato‐vascular regulators ( B^Lyl1^I , B^Fli1^I ) ( C ) and B^Gata1^I ‐ and / or 2‐dependent B^Scl^I binding to B^key^I HSPC transcription factors ( B^Myb^I , B^Runx1^I ) ( D ) . 
A B^Mpc1^I and B^Mpc2^I are present under fermentative conditions , while B^Mpc1^I and Mpc3 are present under respiratory conditions . B^MPC^I subunits were detected by Western B^blot^I in mitochondria isolated from yeast cells grown in glucose ( YPD ) or glycerol ( YPG ) . Mitochondrial matrix protein aconitase ( B^Aco1^I ) , 23‐kDa translocase of the inner B^membrane^I subunit ( B^Tim23^I ) , and 70‐kDa translocase of the outer B^membrane^I subunit ( B^Tom70^I ) were used as loading controls . 
B Kinetics of the switch from B^Mpc2^I to Mpc3 . Yeast cells were grown in YPD until mid‐log phase and then shifted to YPG medium . Whole cell extracts were taken at the indicated time points after the shift , and B^HA^I ‐tagged B^Mpc2^I and Mpc3 detected by Western blotting . Mpc3 is induced very rapidly by switch from YPD to YPG , while B^Mpc2^I levels decrease only gradually . 
C Alternative pyruvate carrier complexes MPCFERM and MPCOX are detected by BN‐PAGE . Isolated mitochondria expressing B^HA^I ‐tagged B^MPC^I proteins were B^run^I on B^blue^I native gels , and B^MPC^I complexes detected B^with^I an B^HA^I ‐specific antibody . MPCFERM consisting of B^Mpc1^I and B^Mpc2^I is present under fermentative conditions , and MPCOX consisting of B^Mpc1^I and Mpc3 is present under respiratory conditions . In addition , a complex of ˜300 kDa is observed under respiratory conditions that contains B^Mpc1^I and Mpc3 . Non‐specific reactivity of the anti‐ B^HA^I antibody toward respiratory chain complexes that are highly abundant in oxidative growth conditions is denoted by an asterisk ( * ) . 
A Constitutive expression of either MPCFERM or MPCOX B^can^I rescue the B^slow^I growth phenotype of the B^mpc1^I Δ B^mpc2^I Δ mpc3 Δ triple deletion mutant . Growth tests were performed B^with^I cells transformed B^with^I B^MPC1^I , B^MPC2^I , or MPC3 expression plasmids or B^with^I empty vectors in indicated combinations . A serial dilution of yeast cells B^was^I spotted on agar plates B^with^I glucose‐containing synthetic minimal medium B^with^I ( B^SD^I + AA ) or without ( SD−AA ) amino acids . 
B Plasmid‐encoded B^MPC^I proteins B^can^I be detected in isolated mitochondria when B^Mpc1^I is co‐expressed B^with^I either B^Mpc2^I or Mpc3 . Cells were grown in selective medium containing glycerol as a carbon source . B^MPC^I subunits were constitutively expressed from plasmids in indicated combinations in the B^mpc1^I Δ B^mpc2^I Δ mpc3 Δ background and detected by Western B^blot^I using anti‐ B^HA^I or anti‐ Flag antibodies . Mitochondrial enzymes aconitase ( B^Aco1^I ) and B^malate dehydrogenase^I ( B^Mdh1^I ) were used as loading controls . 
C BN‐PAGE confirms the formation of MPCFERM and MPCOX complexes after constitutive plasmid‐based protein expression . Non‐specific reactivity of the antibody is denoted by an asterisk ( * ) . It has to be noted that all complexes migrate slightly faster than in Fig C , most likely because B^MPC^I proteins are tagged B^with^I a single epitope B^tag^I as opposed to the 3 B^HA^I ‐tag in Fig C . 
D B^Mpc1^I is co‐immunoprecipitated B^with^I B^Mpc2^I or Mpc3 . Mitochondria isolated from cells harboring appropriate expression plasmids and grown in glycerol‐containing medium were lysed in 1 % digitonin , and either B^Mpc2^I ‐ Flag or Mpc3 ‐ Flag B^was^I immunoprecipitated . B^Mpc1^I ‐ B^HA^I B^was^I detected by Western B^blot^I B^with^I an antibody directed against the epitope B^tag^I . The matrix protein aconitase ( B^Aco1^I ) and 40‐kDa translocase of the outer B^membrane^I subunit ( B^Tom40^I ) were B^not^I co‐immunoprecipitated . 
E , F Stoichiometry of B^Mpc1^I complexes . Chemical cross‐linking indicates that B^Mpc1^I / B^Mpc2^I and B^Mpc1^I / Mpc3 form heterodimers of the predicted molecular weight . DSG , disuccimidyl glutarate . Cross‐linking products B^with^I unknown partners are labeled B^with^I a question mark ( ? ) . 
A , B Determination of B^MPC^I B^membrane^I topology by IASD labeling of isolated mitochondria expressing the indicated single cysteine variants of B^Mpc1^I ( A ) and Mpc3 ( B ) . Mitochondria were treated B^with^I IASD as indicated . Negative [ quenching by pretreatment B^with^I DTT ( pre‐DTT ) ] and positive [ lysis B^with^I 0 . 5 % Triton X‐100 ( T‐X100 ) ] controls B^for^I the labeling reaction are shown . As a further control , also translocase of the inner B^membrane^I subunit B^Tim23^I is detected by Western B^blot^I , which contains three endogenous cysteines , all of which are located in membrane‐embedded regions . Labeling of an IMS‐exposed cysteine B^with^I IASD is indicated by a mobility shift on B^SDS^I - PAGE corresponding to the molecular weight of IASD ( ˜500 Da ) . 
C B^Protease^I protection assay in mitochondria expressing B^Mpc1^I ‐ GFP , B^Mpc2^I ‐ GFP , or Mpc3 ‐ GFP . Intact mitochondria ( M ) , mitoplasts B^with^I a ruptured outer B^membrane^I after hypo‐osmotic swelling ( Sw ) , or mitochondrial lysates B^with^I 0 . 5 % Triton X‐100 ( Tr ) were treated B^with^I proteinase K ( B^PK^I ) . Loading controls are B^Tom70^I ( outer B^membrane^I ) , B^Tim23^I ( inner B^membrane^I ) , and B^Mdh1^I ( matrix ) . GFP ‐fused B^Mpc2^I and Mpc3 are degraded in mitoplasts , whereas B^Mpc1^I ‐ GFP is B^not^I . 
A MPCOX has higher transport activity than MPCFERM . The uptake of 14C‐labeled pyruvate into intact mitochondria B^was^I measured in vitro . Mitochondria B^had^I been isolated from cells grown in glycerol‐containing medium and expressing no subunit ( vectors ) , MPCFERM , MPCOX , B^Mpc2^I , or Mpc3 . Imported pyruvate B^was^I quantified by re‐isolation of mitochondria and subsequent scintillation counting after 1 , 2 , or 5 B^min^I of incubation B^with^I [ 14C ] ‐pyruvate . B Imported [ 14C ] ‐pyruvate as in ( A ) after 5‐min incubation . The difference between MPCOX and MPCFERM ( * * P = 0 . 0037 ) B^was^I significant ( unpaired t‐test ) . 
C Pyruvate dehydrogenase activity B^was^I measured in lysates of mitochondria expressing no subunit ( vectors ) , MPCFERM , or MPCOX . 
The chimeric construct B^Mpc2^I C3 is expressed in isolated mitochondria , while Mpc3 C2 is B^not^I . B^Mpc1^I ‐ B^HA^I and the Flag ‐tagged chimeric proteins were detected by Western blotting in isolated mitochondria . 
Mpc2 C3 forms a carrier complex B^with^I B^Mpc1^I , as analyzed by BN‐PAGE . When co‐expressed B^with^I B^Mpc1^I , B^Mpc2^I C3 shows the same complex pattern as Mpc3 , including the 300K complex . 
Pyruvate transport activity of the B^Mpc1^I / B^Mpc2^I C3 complex reaches ˜85 % of MPCOX activity . Uptake of [ 14C ] ‐pyruvate into mitochondria isolated from yeastcells expressing the indicated B^MPC^I protein combinations B^was^I measured in vitro . Difference between MPCFERM and B^Mpc1^I / B^Mpc2^I C3 is significant ( unpaired t‐test ; * P = 0 . 02 ) . Means of n = 4 experiments are shown , B^with^I error bars representing SEM .

Human B^red^I blood cells ( RBCs ) were incubated B^with^I 400 nM pigment or control Δ B^cylE^I extract , and kinetics of K + and B^Hb^I release B^was^I monitored . Data shown are the average and SEM of six independent experiments . The time to 50 % K + and 50 % B^Hb^I release B^with^I pigment B^was^I 4 . 8 B^min^I and 8 . 4 B^min^I , respectively ; n = 6 , P < 0 . 0001 , extra sum - of - squares F test . 
Role of osmoprotectants in pigment - treated B^RBC^I . HumanRBCs were B^pre^I - incubated B^with^I GBSpigment B^for^I 2 B^min^I at RT , centrifuged , and resuspended in the presence and absence of 30 mM osmoprotectant B^with^I hydrodynamic radius of 0 . 40 nm ( PEG200 ) , 0 . 56 nm ( PEG400 ) , 0 . 89 nm ( PEG1000 ) , 1 . 1 nm ( PEG1500 ) , or 1 . 6 nm ( PEG3000 ) , respectively . Release of B^Hb^I B^was^I measured after 1 h of incubation at 37 °C . Data shown are the average and SEM of three independent experiments . 
Characteristics of B^membrane^I permeabilization by the GBSpigment in artificial lipid bilayers . Lipid bilayers were generated using diphytanoylphosphatidylcholine ( DPhPC ) and treated B^with^I either 2 μM pigment or an equivalent amount of the control Δ B^cylE^I extract . In the pigment - treated sample , channel conductance indicating disruption of the B^membrane^I is seen within 45 s . Erratic and non - discrete fluctuations in current are observed , suggesting the formation of multiple , small B^membrane^I defects . The bilayer eventually breaks at 120 s . In lipid bilayers treated B^with^I the control Δ B^cylE^I extract , the mean ionic current trace remains constant at 0 pA , showing no B^membrane^I disruption . Data shown are representative of three independent experiments .

A , B B^THP^I - 1macrophages proficient B^for^I B^NLRP3^I ( transfected B^with^I scrambled control , A ) or deficient B^for^I B^NLRP3^I ( sh B^NLRP3^I , B ) were treated B^with^I 1 μM pigment or Δ B^cylE^I extract B^for^I 20 B^min^I , and propidium iodide ( PI ) B^was^I added during the final 10 B^min^I . PI uptake B^was^I measured by flow cytometry , and data shown are representative of two independent experiments . 
C , D Intracellular potassium concentration B^was^I measured by B^ICP^I - B^AES^I . B^THP^I - 1macrophages transfected B^with^I the scrambled control ( C ) or sh B^NLRP3^I ( D ) were treated B^with^I GBSpigment ( 1 μM ) or an equivalent amount of the ΔcylE extract . At various time points , cells were lysed and intracellular [ K + ] B^was^I measured relative to untreated cells ( see bars and left y - axis ) , and percent cell death B^was^I quantified by alamar B^blue^I ( see squares , B^dotted^I connecting lines and right y - axis ) . Both B^NLRP3^I - proficient and B^NLRP3^I - deficient macrophages initially lose intracellular K + due to GBSpigment ( compare t = 0 B^min^I to t = 30 B^min^I ) , B^but^I the B^NLRP3^I - deficient cells ( sh B^NLRP3^I ) are able to recover , while the scrambled control do B^not^I , demonstrating that initial K + loss occurs independently of B^NLRP3^I . Data are average of three independent experiments performed B^with^I independent pigment preparations in triplicate and were analyzed using Dunnett ' s multiple comparison test following ANOVA ; all data were compared to control at t = 0 , error bars ± SEM . ( C ) n = 3 , * * * P = 0 . 0002 , * P = 0 . 019 , * * P = 0 . 0032 B^for^I 120 B^min^I , * * P = 0 . 0072 B^for^I 180 B^min^I . ( D ) n = 3 , * * P = 0 . 0043 , * P = 0 . 031 . 
 ( E ) WT B^THP^I - 1macrophages were incubated B^with^I pigment in media containing either 5 mM or 50 mM potassium chloride , and cytotoxicity B^was^I measured by alamar B^blue^I assay . The addition of potassium chloride is able to protect the macrophages from cytolysis , demonstrating that K + efflux is essential B^for^I this process . Data shown are three independent experiments performed in triplicate and were analyzed using Bonferroni ' s multiple comparison test following ANOVA , error bars ± SEM ( n = 3 , * * * * P < 0 . 0001 , * * P = 0 . 0036 ) . 
THP - 1macrophages were treated B^with^I GBSpigment , and caspase 1 activation B^was^I measured by flow cytometry using a FLICA reagent . Pigment treatment of the scrambled shRNA control cell line induces more caspase 1 activation compared to the sh B^NLRP3^I cell line , demonstrating that the pigment activates caspase 1 exclusively through the B^NLRP3^I inflammasome . Results are representative of three independent experiments . 
WT B^THP^I - 1macrophages were treated B^with^I the caspase 1 inhibitor Z - YVAD - FMK , the caspase 3 / 7 inhibitor Z - DEVD - FMK , or DMSO only prior to treatment B^with^I the GBSpigment . YVAD is able to significantly decrease cytotoxicity in cells treated B^with^I GBSpigment , demonstrating that caspase 1 is required B^for^I GBSpigment - mediated cell death , characteristic of pyroptosis , while DEVD B^had^I no effect . Data are average of three independent experiments , error bars ± SEM . Significance B^was^I determined using Bonferroni ' s multiple comparison test following ANOVA ( n = 3 , * * * * P < 0 . 0001 , * * * P = 0 . 0002 , * P = 0 . 014 ) .

One week after transplantation 10 animals / experimental group were treated intraperitoneally B^with^I vehicle ( DMSO ) or two doses of ATRA ( 7 . 5 and 15 . 0 mg / kg ) once / day , 5 days a week B^for^I a total of 24 days . At the B^end^I of this period , treatment B^was^I discontinued until sacrifice . The size of the tumors B^was^I determined B^with^I a caliper and the volume plotted . Associations between components of the retinoid signaling pathway and the phenotype in breast cancer cell lines The figure illustrates the associations between the indicated retinoid receptors / binding proteins and the Luminal versus Basal phenotype ( left panels ) , B^ER^I positivity versus B^ER^I negativity ( middle panels ) as well as B^HER2^I positivity versus B^HER2^I negativity ( right panels ) . The gene - expression microarray and RNA - B^seq^I data refer to 42 and 40 breast cancer cell lines , respectively . The P - values of the indicated comparisons after Student ' s t - test are shown in B^red^I . L ( B^red^I ) = Luminal cell lines ; B ( B^blue^I ) = Basal cell lines ; B^ER^I + ( B^red^I ) = B^ER^I - positive cell lines ; B^ER^I − ( B^red^I ) = B^ER^I - negative cell lines ; B^ER^I − ( B^blue^I ) = B^ER^I - negative Luminal cell lines ; H + ( B^red^I ) = B^HER2^I - positive cell lines ; H− ( B^red^I ) = B^HER2^I - negative cell lines ; H + ( B^blue^I ) = B^HER2^I - positive Luminal cell lines ; H− ( B^blue^I ) = B^HER2^I - negative Luminal cell lines . fpkm = fragments B^per^I kilobase of exon B^per^I million fragments mapped . 
The gene - expression microarray and RNA - B^seq^I data associated B^with^I 40 of the breast cancer cell lines were used B^for^I the analyses . The panels illustrate the associations of RARα and PPARβ / δ B^with^I ATRA sensitivity . The left panels show the basal average levels of the indicated transcript in the cell lines belonging to the B^T1^I and T3 groups ( 13 cell lines in each of the B^T1^I and T3 groups ) defined by ascending ATRA scores . The intermediate and right panels indicate the same results after stratification B^for^I the Luminal ( microarray and RNA - B^seq^I data = 7 cell lines in each of the B^T1^I and T3 groups ) and the Basal ( microarray and RNA - B^seq^I data = 7 cell lines in each of the B^T1^I and T3 groups ) phenotype , respectively . fpkm = fragments B^per^I kilobase of exon B^per^I million fragments mapped .

RNA B^was^I subjected to RT - B^PCR^I analysis to determine the basal expression of the indicated RAR splicing variants . Each value represents the mean ± B^SD^I of two replicate measurements . The table shows the statistical significance of the indicated comparisons . * Significantly different ( P - value < 0 . 05 , Student ' s t - test ) . * * Significantly different ( P - value < 0 . 01 , Student ' s t - test ) .

RARα protein and ATRA sensitivity in breast cancer cell lines Total proteins were extracted from logarithmically growing cell lines and subjected to Western B^blot^I analysis . The panel illustrates representative Western blots B^for^I a number of cell lines . The blots were sequentially developed B^with^I RARα - specific and control tubulin antibodies . The blots are representative of at least two independent experiments providing similar results . 
The quantitative results obtained after densitometric analysis of the RARα bands are plotted against the ATRA scores . Cell lines are grouped according to the ATRA score ( A - D groups and B^T1^I - T3 tertiles ) .

E Rationale B^for^I measuring amplitude and duration of 1st ERK activity peak in response to GF stimulation . Peak amplitude B^was^I measured as the B^ER^I change from when the GF stimulation starts until the highest ERK activity before adaptation occurs . Peak duration B^was^I estimated as the time between the first point before reaching the half‐maximum of the peak in the ascending phase , and the first point after the half‐maximum in the descending phase .

Figure 4 . Topological analysis of cell cycle hub - genes in a protein - protein interaction ( B^PPI^I ) network . Mapping of the B^top^I 30 hub - genes relevant to TBV measures in smaller and bigger B^ASD^I and control brains . A ) Hub - genes that are normally active in control toddlers . B ) Hub - genes that are active in both control and B^ASD^I toddlers . C ) Hub - genes that are abnormally active in B^ASD^I toddlers . Grey nodes are genes in the cell cycle PPIs network that were B^not^I ranked within the B^top^I 30 genes . Black nodes are genes that fall B^out^I from the B^top^I 30 - gene list in B^ASD^I compared to control . 
Figure 5 . High confidence ( Hc ) network . A Hc - network B^was^I generated following the approach represented in Figure 6 . Big nodes represent Hc - genes ( grey or colored circles ) . Small grey or colored circles represent direct downstream targets of the Hc - genes . Colors code B^for^I different categories of genes mapped into the Hc - network . Red indicated genes that are differentially expressed ( DE ) in blood of the same subjects described in this study . Green indicates genes that are both DE and regulatory of the 23 brain - relevant genes . Big cyan diamond shapes are brain - relevant genes that mapped into the Hc - network . L . Prediction of B^mir142^I expression levels in B^mir142^I + / - mESCs . Using the calibration of the reporter ratio response shown in Fig 1G , we could rescale the B^mir142^I + / + distribution ( gray line ) to derive predicted values of miR - 142 concentration in the two stable miR - 142 states . The reporter ratio distribution in B^mir142^I + / mESCs ( purple line ) could be well approximated by the model ( pink B^dotted^I line , ﬁtting parameters : state occupancies ) .

G - I ) Experimental validation of collective survival . All populations grew to high cell densities in the absence of antibiotics ( Blue curves ) . In the presence of antibiotics , only populations B^with^I initial densities greater than NCT grew . NCT B^was^I increased B^with^I the concentration of antibiotics . Engineered bacteria B^with^I the QS - BlaM circuit exhibited a significantly higher NCT than those B^with^I the BlaM or the QS - B^CAT^I circuits . Carbenicillin B^was^I used B^for^I the BlaM and QS - BlaM circuits ; chloramphenicol B^for^I the QS - B^CAT^I circuit . Each error B^bar^I represents the standard deviation from triplicate measurements .

Configuration of the two - compartment model . The microenvironment of microbial swarmbot is separated from that of the chamber by its permeable hydrogel shell ( orange ) , resulting in two separate compartments , defined as swarmbot and environment ( chamber ) . Four major components involved in the population dynamics are explored in the model , including cell density ( n ) , nutrient ( s ) , carbenicillin ( a ) and BlaM concentration ( b ) . Each component has a different transport rate , depending on the molecule size . Simulated microbial swarmbot dynamics under a static condition . a = 0 . 4 , a microbial swarmbot B^with^I a low n0 cannot initiate growth ( B^red^I lines ) B^but^I one B^with^I a high n0 leads to growth both in the swarmbot and , after a delay , in the chamber ( green lines ) . While ( C ) swarmbots B^with^I both low and high initial densities lead to eventual full growth in the chamber in the absence of the antibiotic ( a = 0 ) . Solid lines : cell density inside swarmbots ; dashed lines : cell density in the chambers . ( D ) A microfluidic device B^for^I controlling and monitoring population dynamics of microbial swarmbot . The device consists of an input channel leading to a culturing chamber and a trapping slot . The chamber is used B^for^I culturing engineered bacterial populations both inside and outside the swarmbot , while the trapping slot is B^for^I trapping the swarmbot due to its smaller size B^but^I allowing the medium to flow through . Input flow patterns ( static or pulsing ) are controlled by a programmable syringe pump . ( E ) Experimental validation of model prediction . At 100µg / ml carbenicillin , a microbial swarmbot B^with^I a high initial density led to robust growth in the capsule and , after a delay , in the chamber ( green lines ) . While a swarmbot B^with^I a low initial cell density B^did^I B^not^I exhibit growth either in the swarmbot or in the chamber at the same carbenicillin concentration ( B^red^I lines ) . ( F ) In contrast , both the swarmbot and culturing chamber reached high cell densities in absence of carbenicillin , regardless of the initial cell densities . 
 ( G ) B^Time^I - lapse images of microbial swarmbot dynamics . The population initiated growth inside the swarmbot and subsequently in the chamber at a high initial density . But no growth occurred B^for^I a swarmbot B^with^I a low initial density at the same antibiotic concentration ( rightmost ) . The concentration of carbenicillin B^was^I 100 µg / ml and the scale B^bar^I represents 200 µm . ( H ) The control strain lacking BlaM circuit . The population could B^not^I survive at the same concentration of carbenicillin at the high initial density . 
Time courses of swarmbots treated B^with^I varying concentrations of carbenicillin and glucose . Solid lines indicate cell densities inside swarmbots ; B^dotted^I lines indicate those in the chamber . Safeguard B^was^I established B^for^I lower nutrient levels ( 0 . 004 % or 0 . 04 % glucose ) along B^with^I carbenicillin treatment . At a high nutrient level ( 0 . 4 % glucose ) , the safeguard B^was^I B^lost^I due to either growth in the chamber ( panels 3 and 6 ) or gradual killing of the population inside swarmbot ( solid line in panel 9 ) . These results are qualitatively consistent B^with^I the model predictions ( Fig 4 ) . 
Snapshots of safeguard performance at the B^end^I time point of ( A ) . The B^red^I arrow in panel 6 indicates significant growth in the chamber ; the dimmer fluorescence of the swarmbot in panel 9 indicates killing of the population . 
Figure 6 . Experimental control of microbial swarmbot safeguard by other circuits . Demonstration of modular safeguard performance of swarmbots B^with^I different collective survival systems . B^For^I the swarmbots containing cells carrying the QS - B^CAT^I circuit , pulsing flow of medium containing 100µg / ml chloramphenicol established safeguard control B^but^I B^not^I B^for^I the static condition . B^For^I the swarmbots B^with^I the QS - BlaM circuit , the static condition of 100 µg / ml carbenicillin B^was^I sufficient B^for^I safeguard control . B^For^I all the conditions , safeguard B^did^I B^not^I occur in the absence of antibiotic ( B^top^I panels from each condition ) . All the images were from the swarmbots cultured at 37˚C B^for^I 16 hours . The scale B^bar^I is 250 µm . 
Figure 1 - The origin of N - terminal proteoforms . A . 2 , 578 proteoforms were identified including 2 , 135 dbTIS and 443 aTIS . B^For^I the majority of proteins we found a unique translation initiation site ( grey ) . Additionally , 335 N - terminal peptides pointed to proteins B^with^I multiple N - termini created by alternative translation initiation ( B^blue^I ) , whereas 81 N - termini were generated by alternative iMet processing ( green ) . B - C . Proteomics - derived translation initiation events were verified at the transcript level using Ribo - Seq data obtained in Jurkat cells and B^HCT^I 116 cells ( data unpublished ) . Although in this study , the degree of in vivo Nt - acetylation could B^not^I be directly determined , all retained N - termini were compliant B^with^I the rules of N - terminal processing from previous experiments ( Van Damme et al , 2014 ) . In the case N - termini were found to be in vivo Nt - acetylated ( previous B^MS^I / B^MS^I - based evidence ( Van Damme et al , 2014 ) ) this information is indicated . dbTIS and aTIS peptides were further mapped to protein N - termini annotated in Swiss - B^Prot^I Isoform , UniProt TrEMBL and Ensembl databases and B^neo^I - N - termini ( proteolytic products ) of the knowledgebase TopFind 3 . 0 . The number of matching N - termini is indicated in dark grey . N - terminal peptides supported by at least one source of metadata pointing to translation ( Nt - acetylation , Ribo - Seq , Swiss - B^Prot^I Isoforms , TrEMBL or Ensembl ) were classified as highly confident TIS ( indicated in green ) . D . Using experimental and metadata we assigned the most likely origin of aTIS peptides and confirmed that alternative translation initiation within the same transcript ( leaky scanning ) contributes to the majority of alternative TIS identified . 
Figure 2 - Examples of translation initiation events confirmed by Ribo - Seq in Jurkat cells . A - B . Alternative translation initiation due to leaky scanning . C . Alternative splicing . D . The preferential expression of an N - terminally truncated proteoform confirmed by Ribo - Seq data . E - F . Evidence B^for^I alternative translation initiation occurring at two consecutive AUG codons . 
A . Jurkat cells were B^pre^I - labeled B^with^I B^light^I or medium L - Arg isotopes . A label swap B^was^I performed of cells growing in medium Arg , whereas B^light^I cells were cultured in the same medium . Cells were harvested at different time points and equal proteome amounts were mixed , followed by N - terminal COFRADIC fractionation and LC - B^MS^I / B^MS^I analysis . 
B . Ratios between three dynamic forms of N - terminal peptides reflect protein synthesis and degradation rates , allowing the calculation of 50 % turnover times . 
C . The distribution of turnover times ( N = 1 , 894 ) in our experiment B^was^I B^not^I unimodal , B^with^I a sizable number of quickly turned over proteins , B^with^I the median protein turnover rate being 21 . 6 h . The doubling time of Jurkat cells ( 24 h ) is indicated in B^red^I . 
A . Degradation profiles of B^AIMP2^I , MARE2 and AN32E dbTIS and aTIS proteoforms as representative examples of N - terminal proteoforms that differ in stability . 
B . B^MS^I spectra of the N - termini of two proteoforms originating from the aminoacyl B^tRNA^I synthase complex - interacting multifunctional protein 2 ( B^AIMP2^I ) : a dbTIS indicative N - terminus B^with^I processed iMet and starting at the second amino acid Pro , an aTIS indicative peptide starting at position 3 and retaining its iMet . As evident from the B^MS^I spectra shown , these N - terminal proteoforms displayed largely different turnover rates . 
A . Jurkat cells were treated B^with^I 100 µg / ml CHX B^for^I 0 , 0 . 5 , 1 . 5 , 4 , 8 , 12 or 24 hours . Protein degradation B^was^I monitored by Western blotting and stabilities of several short - lived endogenous proteins were confirmed using antibodies ( including lamin B , securin , β - catenin , GCIP interacting protein B^p29^I ) and compared to stable proteins ( such as B^GAPDH^I and B^actin^I ) . Proteoform - specific bands were used to calculate protein half - lives which were in a good agreement B^with^I turnover times obtained from pSILAC
B - C . Validation of the differential turnover time of the dbTIS and aTIS derived proteoforms of MARE2 and AN32E . Selective C - terminal V5 - tagged proteoforms were overexpressed in HCT116 cells B^for^I 24 hours and CHXpulse - chase experiments were performed as described B^for^I Jurkat cells . Degradation of overexpressed proteoforms B^was^I monitored by an anti - V5 antibody and compared to the turnover of stable proteins such as B^actin^I and tubulin .

Error bars indicate SEM .

Left - and rightward preferences are shown as green and B^red^I bars , respectively . Abrupt transitions from left - to rightward preference correspond to chromosomal interaction domain boundaries . B Proteins are classified as B^CBL^I interactors according to their position in a volcano plot in which the mean p - value is plotted against the corresponding mean enrichment B^for^I B^CBL^I ( t ) > ( t ) > B^OST^I versus WT samples . The time point shown corresponds to the unstimulated condition ( t = 0s ) . Mean B^was^I calculated using bootstrap resampling ( see Results and Material and Methods ) . Proteins that displayed an enrichment r ( t ) greater than 2 - fold and a corresponding p - value p ( t ) lower than a B^set^I threshold ( see Material and Methods ) in more than 90 % of the bootstrap iterations were selected as specific partners ( indicated in B^red^I ) . Names of four of the most significantly enriched proteins are indicated . Dashed lines represent thresholds on the p - value p * = 10 - 3 and the enrichment r * = 2 used to identify specific interactors of B^CBL^I .

Oligo # 5 B^with^I cy3 at the 5 ' B^end^I showed 86 % inclusion , B^with^I Cy3 at the 3 ' B^end^I 17 % exon inclusion . F . Statistical analysis of the effect of oligonucleotide modification . The effect is significant , p = 0 . 009 , n = 4 . 
D . In vitro splicing assay : Uniformly labeled in vitro transcribed RNA B^was^I incubated B^with^I HeLanuclear extract ( NE ) under splicing conditions B^for^I two hours at 30 ºC . The structures of the in vitro splicing products are shown on the right . LI and LII are two lariats formed . Numbers indicate the expected product lengths . E . Quantification of selected bands from four independent experiments . The percentage of each form in the total products is shown . The differences of splice products ( Va + b - MINX ) is significant , p = 0 . 0055 ; n = 3 . 
B . Effect of oligo # 5 on B^pre^I - mRNA splicing of the reporter gene , stably transfected into HeLa cells . 
C . Effect of oligo # 5 on the truncated 5HT2C protein . Stable cell lines expressing the construct shown in panel ( A ) were treated B^with^I oligo # 3 and oligo # 5 . After 48 hrs cells were separated in B^membrane^I containing fractions and soluble cytosolic supernatant . The fractions were analyzed by Western B^Blot^I using the anti - B^RNA1^I antiserum ( Figure EV1 ) . The protein samples were on the same B^membrane^I , B^but^I the supernatant fractions were exposed about B^ten^I times longer . D . Effect of oligo # 5 on the full - length 5HT2C protein . The protein B^was^I prepared as in panel ( C ) and analyzed using a polyclonal anti - GFP antiserum . E . Quantification of panels C and D from three independent experiments . The ratio of protein signal after oligo # 3 and oligo # 5 treatment is shown B^for^I B^RNA1^I ( p = 0 . 002 ) and B^RNA2^I ( p = 0 . 0003 ) , n = 3 , respectively . 
F , G . Effect of oligo # 5 on localization of the EGFP - tagged serotonin 2C receptor . Confocal microscopy images of three representative pictures are shown . H . Quantitification of GFP signal found on the B^membrane^I after oligo # 5 addition . The signal around the peripheral region B^was^I determined by visual inspection and calculated as a fraction of total signal using B^NIH^I image . 200 cells from three individual experiments were analyzed , p < 0 . 008 , n = 200 . 
A . Accumulation of Cy3 - labeled oligo # 5 in the area around the 3rd ventricle one hour B^post^I injection , shown is the ventral part of a coronal section - 1 . 34 mm from Bregma . The injection coordinates were B^AP^I : - 1 . 82 mm , DV : - 4 . 5 mm , B^ML^I : 0 . B . Uptake of oligo # 5 in the arcuate nucleus region ( B^arc^I ) , enlarged from panel A . 
C . Oligo # 5 enters neurons . Enlargement of hypothalamus region taking up oligo # 5 ( B^red^I ) , stained B^for^I the neuronal marker NeuN ( green ) . Most of the oligo # 5 signal is in neurons , B^but^I some is also in NeuN negative cells ( arrow ) , likely glia . D . Oligo # 5 enters some glia cells . The oligo ( B^red^I ) B^can^I be found in some B^GFAP^I - positive glia cells ( arrow ) , B^but^I numerous B^GFAP^I - positive cells ( green ) show no oligo # 5 uptake . 
E . Effect of oligo # 5 on B^RNA1^I / B^RNA2^I ratios in the injected area . H . Effect of oligo # 5 on food uptake in wild - type mice . C57BL / 6 wild - type mice received a guide canulae and B^did^I B^not^I have access to food B^for^I 16 hours . After injection of 2 µg oligonucleotides , they could freely access food . The food consumption B^was^I measured by weighing the food used . A total of 52 animals were used , p = 0 . 001 B^for^I the difference between oligo # 5 and control oligonucleotides . Each of the six individual experiments showed statistically significant differences between oligo # 5 and control ( p < 0 . 01 - 0 . 001 ) . Control oligo : an oligonucleotide against human B^SMN2^I . 
I . Effect of oligo # 5 on food uptake in ob / ob mice . Ob / ob mice received oligo # 5 through ICV injection , similar to panel F . However , the mice could freely access food at all times ( p = 0 . 04 , n = 3 ) .

 ( B ) B^Time^I constants of decay , τdecay , of the B^STC^I isolated pharmacologically in WT and FHM2 KI mice . Top , superimposed representative traces of the inward current evoked in an astrocyte ( held at - 90 mV ) by a single pulse stimulation ( indicated by the arrow ) in a WT slice , before ( trace a ) and after ( trace b ) application of a saturating concentration of the GluT inhibitor TFB - TBOA ( TBOA ) . The B^STC^I B^was^I obtained by subtracting the residual current remaining in the presence of TBOA from the total inward current ( trace a - b ) ; the decay of the B^STC^I B^was^I best fitted by a single exponential function B^with^I τdecay = 6 . 53 ms ( in B^red^I ) . The B^bar^I plot shows the average values of τdecay of the B^STC^I isolated pharmacologically in cortical slices ( n = 13 ) from B^P22^I - 23 WT ( N = 7 ) and KI mice ( n = 9 ; N = 3 ) . B^STC^I τdecay is 17 % higher in KI compared to WT astrocytes ( unpaired t - test : P = 0 . 003 ) . Hereafter , n indicates the number of slices and N indicates the number of mice . 
 ( C ) τdecay of the B^STC^I isolated using an exponential waveform approximating the average TBOA - insensitive current in WT and KI mice . Top trace , average normalized TBOA - insensitive current obtained by pooling the normalized TBOA - insensitive currents recorded in 16 WT and KI cells . This current B^was^I best fitted by an exponentially rising function ( 1 - B^exp^I ( - t / τrise ) ) B^with^I τrise = 2 . 35 ms ( in green ) . The B^STC^I B^was^I obtained by subtracting from the total current elicited in the astrocyte ( a : same representative trace as in ( B ) ) the exponential function A ( 1 - B^exp^I ( - t / τrise ) ) B^with^I τrise = 2 . 35 ms and A equal to the maximal current measured in the astrocyte at about 60 ms after stimulation ( trace c ) ; the decay of the B^STC^I ( trace a - c ) B^was^I best fitted by a single exponential function B^with^I τdecay = 6 . 49 ms ( in B^red^I ) . The B^bar^I plot shows the average values of τdecay of the B^STC^I isolated as shown in the B^top^I panel in cortical slices from B^P22^I - 23 WT ( n = 28 ; N = 11 ) and KI mice ( n = 27 ; N = 9 ) . B^STC^I τdecay is 21 % higher in KI compared to WT astrocytes ( unpaired t - test : P < 0 . 0001 ) . 
 ( A ) Isolation of the B^STC^I elicited by the last pulse of a high - frequency train of action potentials . Left : superimposed representative traces of the inward current evoked in an astrocyte ( held at - 90 mV ) by extracellular stimulation B^with^I a train of 10 pulses ( trace a : black ) and a train of 9 pulses ( trace b : brown ) at 50 Hz in a WT cortical slice . The inward current elicited by the 10th pulse B^was^I obtained by subtracting the current elicited by 9 pulses from that elicited by 10 pulses ( trace a - b ) . Right : The B^STC^I elicited by the 10th pulse ( trace a - b - c ) B^was^I obtained by subtracting the exponential function that simulates the TBOA - insensitive current elicited by a single pulse ( trace c , obtained as in Figure 1C ) to the 10 - 9 pulses difference current ( trace a - b ) . The decay of the B^STC^I elicited by the 10th pulse B^was^I best fitted by a single exponential function B^with^I τdecay = 8 . 04 ms ( in B^red^I ) . 
 ( B ) τdecay of the B^STC^I elicited by the 10th pulse of 50 Hz ( τ10 ( 50 Hz ) , left panel ) and 100 Hz ( τ10 ( 100 Hz ) , right panel ) trains in layer 1 astrocytes in acute cortical slices from B^P22^I - 23 WT ( n = 23 ; N = 10 B^for^I 50 Hz ; n = 18 ; N = 8 B^for^I 100 Hz ) and KI ( n = 21 ; N = 9 B^for^I 50 Hz and n = 14 ; N = 7 B^for^I 100 Hz ) mice . The B^STC^I elicited by the 10th pulse B^was^I obtained as described in ( A ) . B^STC^I τ10 ( 50 Hz ) and τ10 ( 100 Hz ) are 30 % and 37 % higher in KI compared to WT mice , respectively ( unpaired t - test : P < 0 . 0001 in both cases ) . 
 ( A ) Simultaneous visualization of B^GLT^I - 1a + ( green ) and VGLUT1 + puncta ( B^red^I ) in first somatic sensory cortex ( B^SI^I ) of a WT and a KI mouse ( B^P35^I ) . Arrows point to some B^GLT^I - 1a + puncta overlaying B^with^I VGLUT1 + puncta ( i . e . , B^GLT^I - 1a / VGLUT1 related puncta ) ; framed regions ( enlarged below ) are examples of B^GLT^I - 1a / VGLUT1 related puncta ( arrowheads ) . Left , percentage of B^GLT^I - 1a + puncta overlaying B^with^I VGLUT1 is comparable in WT and KI mice ( data were obtained from 14 and 18 fields of 20 µm x 20 µm from 2 WT and 2 KI mice ( 4 sections / animal ) , respectively ) ( unpaired t - test : P = 0 . 52 ) . Right , size of B^GLT^I - 1a / VGLUT1 related puncta is 19 % reduced in KI mice ( 169 B^GLT^I - 1a + puncta analyzed from 2 mice ) compared to WT ( 174 B^GLT^I - 1a + puncta analyzed from 2 mice ) ( Mann - Withney U test : P = 0 . 016 ) . 
 ( A ) Distribution of B^GLT^I - 1a gold particles in astrocytic processes contacting asymmetric synapses ( perisynaptic astrocytic processes : B^PAP^I ) in B^SI^I of 5 WT and 5 KI ( 2 male , 3 female ) mice ( B^P34^I - 35 ) . In cortical B^PAP^I of KI mice the density ( particles / µm2 ) of total and B^membrane^I - associated gold particles ( arrowheads ) are reduced compared to WT mice , whereas the density of cytoplasmicgold particles ( arrows ) is comparable to that in WT ( cf Table I B^for^I numerical values and statistics ) . 
 ( B ) Distribution of B^GLT^I - 1a gold particles in excitatory axon terminals forming asymmetric synaptic contact ( AxT ) in B^SI^I of B^P34^I - 35 WT and KI mice . In cortical AxT of KI and WT mice , B^GLT^I - 1a density is comparable ( arrowheads : B^membrane^I - associated gold particles ; arrows : cytoplasmicgold particles ) ( cf Table I ) . 
Left , superimposed representative traces of the normalized inward current evoked in a WT ( black trace ) and a KI corticalastrocyte ( B^blue^I trace ) by extracellular stimulation B^with^I a train of 10 pulses at 50 Hz in cortical slices . The inset shows in an expanded time scale the portion of the traces indicated by the B^dotted^I line . The slowly decaying current ( τdecay = 2 . 00 s and 3 . 04 s B^for^I the WT and KI trace , respectively ) is largely a [ K + ] e - dependent K + current ( IK ) whose decay kinetics provide a measure of the rate of K + clearance by astrocytes ( see text ) . Right , time constant of decay of IK elicited by trains of 10 pulses at 50 Hz in corticalastrocytes from B^P22^I - 23 WT ( n = 21 ; N = 12 ) and KI mice ( n = 20 ; N = 8 ) . IK τdecay is 22 % higher in KI compared to WT astrocytes ( unpaired t - test : P = 0 . 001 ) . 
 ( A ) Images of a cortical slice before ( t = 0 ) and after ( t = 15 . 6 s ) pressure ejection of a high KCl pulse that elicits a B^CSD^I ( B^top^I panels ) , showing that the propagating B^CSD^I is associated B^with^I a change in B^light^I transmittance . Scale B^bar^I : 500 µm . The traces below show representative changes in intrinsic optical signal ( IOS ) relative to background measured in a WT and a KI cortical slice during B^CSD^I propagation at increasing times and distances from the KCl B^puff^I , as indicated in color code in the right image on the B^top^I . The velocity of B^CSD^I propagation , obtained from the rate of horizontal spread of the change in IOS , in these two representative WT and KI slices is 3 . 11 and 4 . 14 mm / B^min^I , respectively . ( B ) Stimulation threshold B^for^I B^CSD^I induction ( B^CSD^I threshold ) and rate of B^CSD^I propagation ( B^CSD^I velocity ) in WT ( n = 24 ; N = 3 ) and KI ( n = 27 ; N = 8 ) cortical slices from B^P22^I - 23 mice . B^CSD^I threshold is expressed as duration of the first KCl pulse eliciting a B^CSD^I . B^CSD^I threshold is 28 % lower ( Mann Whitney U test , P < 0 . 0001 ) and B^CSD^I velocity 21 % higher ( unpaired t - test : P < 0 . 0001 ) in KI compared to WT mice .

The steady - state effect B^was^I reached within 10 - 15 minutes from the beginning of the drug perfusion .

F Overexpression of B^RNF123^I enhances NDV - B^eGFP^I replication . HEK293T cells ( 1×105 ) were transfected B^with^I the expression plasmids B^for^I Flag - B^RNF123^I or empty vector ( 2 µg ) . At 24 h after transfection , cells were infected B^with^I NDV - B^eGFP^I . At 30 h after infection , viral replication B^was^I determined by GFP expression visualized by fluorescence microscopy and analyzed by western B^blot^I . 
G B^RNF123^I enhances EMCV replication . HeLa cells ( 1×105 ) were transfected B^with^I the expression plasmids B^for^I Flag - B^RNF123^I or empty vector ( 2 µg ) . At 24 h after transfection , cells were infected B^with^I EMCV or given DMEM B^with^I no virus . At 18 h after infection , viral replication B^was^I determined by B^VP1^I expression , which B^was^I analyzed by western B^blot^I . 
A HEK293T cells B^with^I stable knockdown of B^RNF123^I were generated using shRNA . Western B^blot^I B^was^I performed B^with^I anti - B^RNF123^I , anti - B^VISA^I ( as a control ) , and anti - B^GAPDH^I antibodies after infection B^with^I five lentiviruses encoding a shRNA control ( GFP sh ) and four shRNAs targeting B^RNF123^I ( B^RNF123^I sh # 1 , # 2 , # 3 , and # 4 ) in HEK293T cells .

At 12 h after transfection , they were infected B^for^I 12 h B^with^I SeV or EMCV or left uninfected , followed by analysis as described in the legend of Fig 1A .

A , B B^RNF123^I inhibits the activation of the IFN - β ( A ) promoters induced by the overexpression of RIG - I , RIG - I CARD , MDA5 CARD , and B^VISA^I , B^but^I has no effect on the B^TBK1^I - and B^IRF3^I - 5D - induced activation of the IFN - β promoter ( A ) . B^Luciferase^I assays were performed 24 h after transfection . 
D B^RNF123^I interacted B^with^I RIG - I and MDA5 , B^but^I B^not^I B^VISA^I , B^TBK1^I , and B^cGAS^I . HEK293T cells ( 1×106 ) were transfected B^with^I Flag - B^RNF123^I ( F - B^RNF123^I ) together B^with^I B^HA^I - RIG - I , B^HA^I - MDA5 , B^HA^I - B^VISA^I , B^HA^I - B^TBK1^I , or B^HA^I - B^cGAS^I plasmids ( 8 μg each ) . Cell lysates were immunoprecipitated ( B^IP^I ) B^with^I anti - B^HA^I ( α B^HA^I ) . The immunoprecipitates were analyzed by western blotting ( immunoblotting [ IB ] ) B^with^I anti - Flag ( αF ) or anti - B^HA^I antibody ( α B^HA^I ) . Whole - cell lysates ( WCL ) were analyzed by western blotting B^with^I anti - B^HA^I and anti - Flag antibodies to determine the expression levels of transfected plasmids . 
E Endogenous interaction of B^RNF123^I B^with^I RIG - I upon SeV infection . HEK293T cells ( 3×106 ) were treated B^with^I SeV B^for^I 12 h or left untreated . Cell lysates were immunoprecipitated B^with^I rabbit anti - B^RNF123^I antibody or control IgG . The immunoprecipitates were analyzed by western blotting B^with^I rabbit anti - RIG - I antibody . The expression levels of the endogenous proteins were analyzed by western blotting B^with^I anti - RIG - I and anti - B^RNF123^I antibodies . 
F Endogenous interaction of B^RNF123^I B^with^I MDA5 upon EMCV infection . HeLa cells ( 3×106 ) were treated B^with^I EMCV B^for^I 12 h or left untreated . Cell lysates were immunoprecipitated B^with^I rabbit anti - B^RNF123^I antibody or control IgG . The immunoprecipitates were analyzed by western blotting B^with^I rabbit anti - MDA5 antibody . The expression levels of the endogenous proteins were analyzed by western blotting B^with^I anti - MDA5 and anti - B^RNF123^I antibodies . Each histogram shows the mean ± B^SD^I of three independent experiments done in triplicate . * * * P < 0 . 001 ; * * P < 0 . 01 ; * P < 0 . 1 ; ns , P > 0 . 05 .

Twenty - four hours after transfection , reporter activity B^was^I measured and plotted after normalizing B^with^I respect to Renilla luciferase activity . b ) Region of 1H - 15N - HSQC TROSY spectra containing resonances of the cross - over helix residues S107 and Q106 are overlaid : unconjugated 15N - B^UbcH7^I ( B^blue^I ) , 15N - B^UbcH7^I - O - Ub ( black ) , and 15N - B^UbcH7^I - O - Ub I44A ( B^red^I ) . Peaks representing S107 and Q106 in the context of B^UbcH7^I ~ Ub - I44A ( B^red^I ) are closer to peaks observed in free B^UbcH7^I ( B^blue^I ) than B^UbcH7^I ~ Ub - WT ( black ) indicating that I44A of Ub disrupts interactions B^with^I the cross - over helix of B^UbcH7^I . 
a ) Region of 1H - 15N - HSQC TROSY spectra that contains Gln49 Ub resonance are overlaid : free 15N - Ub ( B^blue^I ) , B^UbcH7^I - O - 15N - Ub ( black ) , and B^HHARI^I B^RING1^I - bound B^UbcH7^I - O - 15N - Ub ( B^red^I ) . Black arrow highlights perturbation upon conjugation to B^UbcH7^I ( black arrow ) and B^red^I arrow highlights perturbation of conjugated Ub upon B^HHARI^I B^RING1^I binding to B^UbcH7^I . 
b ) Region of 1H - 13C - HSQC spectra of 13C - B^UbcH7^I ( B^blue^I ) , 13C - B^UbcH7^I - O - Ub ( black ) , and B^HHARI^I B^RING1^I - bound 13C - B^UbcH7^I - O - Ub ( B^red^I ) that includes the methyl ( 13CH3 ) resonance of the surface - exposed B^UbcH7^I cross - over helix residue , Ala 110 ( black arrow ) is shown . The 13CH3 peak of Ala110 either broadens dramatically or shifts to an unknown position in the spectrum of 13C - B^UbcH7^I - O - Ub ( black ) and reappears at its position in free B^UbcH7^I in the presence of B^HHARI^I B^RING1^I , consistent B^with^I disruption of closed B^UbcH7^I ~ Ub conformations . Pairwise overlays and larger spectra are provided in Appendix Fig S3 . 
c ) Regions of 1H - 15N - HSQC - TROSY spectra of B^UbcH7^I - O - 15N - Ub in the absence ( black ) and presence ( B^red^I ) of a B^RING1^I domain from the B^RBR^I E3s B^HHARI^I ( left ) or RNF144 ( middle ) or a canonical B^RING^I domain of B^BRCA1^I / B^BARD1^I ( right ) . The perturbations on Ub due to binding of B^HHARI^I B^RING1^I and RNF144 B^RING1^I are remarkably similar , while binding of the canonical B^RING^I domain of B^BRCA1^I / B^BARD1^I has no observable effect on the Ub spectrum . a ) LEFT . c ) B^UbcH7^I ~ Ub conjugates were preformed B^with^I either B^with^I WT - Ub or I44A - Ub . d ) B^UbcH7^I conjugated B^with^I WT - Ub , I44A - Ub , or V70A Ub as indicated B^was^I incubated B^with^I either H887A - B^HOIP^I B^RBR^I - LDD ( left ) or H359A - B^HHARI^I B^RBR^I ( right ) mutants that allow trapping of the B^E3^I ~ Ub thioester B^with^I WT - Ub ( Stieglitz et al , 2013 ; [ 29 ] ) . While a B^HOIP^I ~ Ub thioester species is observed when B^UbcH7^I B^was^I charged B^with^I WT - Ub , no detectable transfer occurs B^with^I the I44A - Ub conjugate ( left ) . Similarly , V70A - Ub shows reduced formation of the B^HHARI^I ~ Ub thioester ( right ) . In addition to blotting B^for^I B^HA^I - Ub , the B^blot^I on the right B^was^I also blotted B^for^I B^GST^I - B^HHARI^I .

A Structure of autoinhibited ScV1 . The catalytic A ( pink ) and non catalytic B ( green ) subunits are arranged as a heterohexamer around the central rotor subunits D ( B^red^I ) and F ( cyan ) . The three peripheral stalks ( EG heterodimers 1 - 3 , B^blue^I and orange , respectively ) are bound at the periphery of the B subunits . The inhibitory H subunit ( yellow ) is unique to the eukaryotic V - B^ATPase^I . Unless otherwise stated , the coloring scheme used here B^for^I the V1 subunits will be used from here on . 
B Interaction of the peripheral stalks B^with^I the catalytic hexamer . Each peripheral stalk crosses a non - catalytic A / B interface on its way from the B^top^I of the V1 to the base of the catalytic core . Representative view of the interaction is shown B^for^I B^EG3^I . 
C Interaction of peripheral stalks B^EG1^I and 2 B^with^I the catalytic hexamer . The peripheral stalks are bound to the B^top^I of the B subunits via their C - termini ( boxed ) . The electron density ( contoured at 1 . 2 σ ) B^for^I the C - terminal domains of B^EG1^I and B^EG2^I is shown in the panels to the left and right . D The structure of autoinhibited ScV1rotated 90° around the vertical from the view shown in panel A to highlight peripheral stalks B^EG2^I and B^EG3^I . Note the bent appearance of B^EG3^I compared to B^EG2^I along B^with^I the presence of a partially unstructured region known as the " bulge " in subunit G ( indicated B^with^I an arrow ) . The box shows electron density ( contoured at 1 . 2 σ ) B^for^I the B^EG3^I N - termini contacting the C - terminal domain of the A subunit of a closed catalytic site ( see asterisk ) . The horizontal lines on the structure indicate the sections shown in panels E ( upper two lines ) and F ( lower two lines ) . 
E Section through the ScV1 electron density B^map^I showing interaction of the A3B3 catalytic hexamer B^with^I the peripheral stalks ( B^EG1^I - 3 ) . View is rotated 90° from the view in A , looking up the central rotor . The A / B pairs forming the three catalytic sites are designated ( AB ) 1 - 3 according to which of the three peripheral stalks is bound to each B subunit . B^For^I example , ( AB ) 1 has peripheral stalk B^EG1^I bound to its B subunit . The black arrowheads indicate the non - catalytic A / B interfaces . 
F Section through the ScV1 electron density B^map^I at the level of the N - termini of the peripheral stalks . Note the change in position of the N - termini of the peripheral stalks , which have each crossed a non - catalytic interface ( black arrowheads in E ) and are now in proximity to the C - termini of the catalytic A subunits ( B^ACT^I ) of the adjacent A / B pairs . While B^EG1^I and B^EG2^I are now near B^ACT^I from ( AB ) 3 and ( AB ) 1 , respectively ( see B^double^I headed arrows ) , only the bent B^EG3^I peripheral stalk is close enough to contact the corresponding B^ACT^I from ( AB ) 2 ( see asterisk ) . 
A The A3B3DF complex shown B^with^I the subunits unique to the eukaryotic V1 removed , highlighting the core conserved catalytic complex labeled as " Catalytic core " . The three peripheral stalks and inhibitory subunit H are found only in the eukaryotic V1 , whereas A3B3DF represents the full complement of subunits in the prokaryotic V1 complex . Notably , the prokaryotic V1 is an active ATP hydrolase ( Arai et al , 2009 ) . The orientation of the A and B subunits B^with^I respect to the B^membrane^I is indicated by the arrow on the left . 
B Conformational differences in the catalytic A subunits . The catalytic A subunits are shown aligned by their N - terminal β barrels , highlighting the change in conformation of C - terminal α helical bundles associated B^with^I the closed ( ( AB ) 2 and ( AB ) 3 ; dark and B^light^I gray , respectively ) and open ( ( AB ) 1 ; magenta ) catalytic sites . Movement of this domain in response to nucleotide occupancy is thought to drive rotation of the central rotor during catalysis . 
C ScV1 ' s catalytic hexamer contains one open and two closed catalytic sites . Side view of the three catalytic hexamer A / B pairs ( shown in surface representation ) . Note that the two closed pairs ( AB ) 2 and 3 are non - equivalently closed . 
D Alignment of the A3B3DF from ScV1 and nucleotide - free EhV1 by the catalytic hexamers . The A3B3DF from ScV1 is shown in the same color scheme as in Fig 2 , EhV1 is in B^blue^I . The alignment shows the difference in position of the central rotor subunit , D . Note that the C - terminus of subunit D ( B^DCT^I ) is longer in eukaryotic V - B^ATPase^I ( see electron density contoured at 1 . 2 σ in the box to the right ) . E ScV1 and EhV1are halted in different rotational positions . Alignment of the A3B3DF of ScV1 and nucleotide - free EhV1 ( B^blue^I , B^with^I dashed lines drawn through the A subunits ) by the central stalk subunit D , reveals that the two catalytic cores are halted in different rotational positions . The autoinhibited ScV1 requires 40° rotation to overlay its catalytic hexamer B^with^I that of the EhV1 . 
F Comparison of the D subunits of ScV1 ( B^red^I ) and nucleotide free EhV1 ( B^blue^I ) . B^HCT^I from ScV1 is shown in yellow and A subunit from EhV1 is shown in dark B^blue^I . 
A ScV1 - H subunit interactions . Region of electron density ( contoured at 1 . 2 σ ) outlined by the box in the B^side^I view of ScV1 shown to the right . The H subunit N - terminal domain ( HNT ) is bound to the N - terminal α helices of peripheral stalk B^EG1^I while its globular C - terminal domain ( B^HCT^I ) is bound at the base of the catalytic hexamer . 
B Interaction between HNT and peripheral stalk B^EG1^I . View of HNT as in panel A rotated 110° along the horizontal , showing the α helical HEAT repeats of HNTforming a pocket B^for^I binding the N - termini of peripheral stalk B^EG1^I . HNT ' s α helices forming the pocket are labeled as in ( Sagermann et al , 2001 ) . Pro197 on HNT ( B^red^I sphere ) has been previously shown to cross - B^link^I subunit E ( Jefferies & Forgac , 2008 ) . C Interaction between B^HCT^I and the base of the catalytic hexamer . The H subunit inhibitory contacts at the base of the ScV1 are mediated by a loop in B^HCT^I ( highlighted in magenta ) that is seen to contact two short segments of the C - terminal domain of the subunit G from the open catalytic site ( AB ) 1 ( highlighted in purple ) and two turns of the N - terminal a helix of the central rotor subunit D ( highlighted in B^blue^I ) . 
D B^HCT^I binds to the open ( AB ) 1 pair . View of ScV1 looking along the central rotor subunit D towards the cytoplasm , showing the position of the H subunit binding at the interface of the open A / B pair ( AB ) 1 . The catalytic hexamer is shown in surface representation and the central rotor , peripheral stalks and subunit H are shown as ribbons . 
C Growth phenotype of H subunit mutants . Deletion of V - B^ATPase^I subunits from yeast results in a conditional lethal phenotype ( Vma - ) characterized by an inability to grow at pH 7 . 5 in the presence of 60 mM CaCl2 ( upper panel ) , B^but^I growth is observed at pH 5 ( lower panel ) . Subunit H mutations were introduced on a plasmid into a yeast strain deleted B^for^I the H subunit and their phenotypes assessed . Both human H subunit isoforms ( HsH1 , HsH2 ) , a chimeric H subunit ( HChim ) containing ScHNT and HsHCT , mutations in yeast intended to mimic the length of the human H loop sequence and accessibility ( Hloop ) , and a point mutation of the conserved aspartic acid residue in the loop sequence ( HD410A ) are shown compared to the H subunit deletion ( ΔH ) and wild type H on a plasmid ( H WTpl ) . All grow on pH 5 medium , B^but^I the human isoforms failed to complement the deletion phenotype . 
D B^ATPase^I activity of H subunit mutants . The ScV1 sectors were purified from each strain that complemented the phenotype as well as from ScV1ΔH , B^for^I comparison of MgATPase activity . Average specific activities are shown plotted + / - s . e . m from two independent purifications . The ScV1 sector containing chromosomally encoded H subunit shows no detectable MgATPase activity ( Parra et al , 2000 ; Zhang et al , 2003 ) , whereas ScV1containing plasmid - borne wild type H ( H WTpl ) exhibits low levels of activity likely due to reduced expression from the low copy plasmid . The HChim and HLoop mutants lead to a loss of activity silencing , displaying nearly the same activity as ScV1ΔH . 
E B^SDS^I - PAGE and Western B^Blot^I analysis of ScV1 preparations . Left panel , 15 % B^SDS^I PAGE of ScV1 purified from the subunit H mutant and WT strains . Note that H WTch is purified from a yeast strain deleted B^for^I the C subunit ( used B^for^I crystallization ) . The remaining strains contain subunit C , which is co - purified B^with^I ScV1 in varying levels . Note that while H WTch ScV1 , which is expressed from a strain deleted B^for^I subunit C , displays no detectable MgATPase activity , the H subunit mutants co - purified B^with^I the most C subunit display the least activity , suggesting that absence or presence of subunit C has no effect on MgATPase activity . Right panel , immunoblot probed B^with^I an antibody directed against the N - terminal B^Myc^I tagged mutant H subunits expressed from a plasmid . Note that the levels of mutant H expression does B^not^I appear to vary from strain to strain . 
A Overlay of ScV1 and the cryo - EM structure of the V1Vo holoenzyme in " state 2 " ( Zhao et al , 2015 ) . The structures of ScV1 and ScV1Vo were overlaid by aligning the A3B3 catalytic hexamers , thus highlighting structural differences in the central rotor and peripheral stator subunits . Coloring of ScV1Vo ( shown as semi - transparent ribbons ) is as used throughout B^for^I ScV1 B^for^I all B^but^I the A3B3F ( B^tan^I ) , subunit H ( dark green ) , subunit C and Vo domain ( gray ) . The B^EG1^I - HNT interaction is boxed . Note the shift in position of HNT and B^EG1^I between ScV1 and ScV1Vo . 
B Comparison of peripheral stalk B^EG1^I and HNT in ScV1 versus ScV1Vo . The boxed view in A is shown enlarged . The N - terminal α helices of peripheral stalk B^EG1^I and HNT change in conformation , likely induced by the movement of B^HCT^I when going from the holo enzyme to the autoinhibited conformation . 
C View as in A rotated 150º around the vertical . Comparisons of peripheral stalk B^EG3^I and B^HCT^I are boxed . D Comparison of peripheral stalk B^EG3^I in ScV1 versus ScV1Vo . In ScV1Vo , B^EG3^I binds to the C subunit head domain ( Chead ; gray ) whereas in ScV1 , B^EG3^I is bent towards the C - terminal domain of a catalytic A subunit ( enlarged view of box labeled B^EG3^I in panel C ) . E Comparison of B^HCT^I ' s conformation in ScV1 versus ScV1Vo . Enlarged view of box labeled B^HCT^I in panel C highlighting the conformational changes and binding interactions of B^HCT^I ; B^for^I clarity only aNT , B^HCT^I and the central rotor ( DF ) are shown . In ScV1Vo , the most C - terminal α helix ( dark green ) of B^HCT^I ( green ) binds to aNT ( B^light^I gray ) , B^with^I the inhibitory loop ( green spheres ) rotated away and inaccessible B^for^I binding the B subunit and the central stalk ( transparent B^red^I ) . In ScV1 , the B^HCT^I ( yellow ) inhibitory loop ( yellow spheres ) binds to the central stalk subunit D ( B^red^I ) and the B subunit of the open ( AB ) 1 catalytic site . The difference in conformation between ScV1Vo and ScV1 involves a ~ 150° rotation of B^HCT^I . Note that the B^HCT^I loop ( spheres ) is rotated away from the central stalk in ScV1Vo whereas in ScV1 , the C - terminal α helix ( orange ) involved in binding aNT is rotated away and unavailable B^for^I rebinding to the B^membrane^I . 
F B^HCT^I conformational changes . Available subunit H structures as obtained B^for^I isolated H ( Sagermann et al , 2001 ) ( purple ) , in ScV1Vo ( Zhao et al , 2015 ) ( green ) and in ScV1 ( yellow ) are shown aligned by their N - terminal domains ( HNT ) illustrating the conformational flexibility of B^HCT^I . The loop involved in inhibition of ScV1 is shown as B^red^I spheres , highlighting the 180º rotation of B^HCT^I when going from the conformation of isolated H ( B^HCT^I 1ho8 ) to the inhibitory conformation in ScV1 ( B^HCT^I ScV1 ) .

 ( A ) B^FRH^I large cell ( cyan ) , B^Mtr4^I ( pdb 2XGJ , green , RNA backbone in orange ) , and B^FRH^I small alternate cell ( B^blue^I ) differ primarily in the orientation of the B^arch^I domain . The B^FRH^I RNA - bound structure also crystallizes in the small - cell configuration . The two different B^FRH^I structures have an overall RMSD of 3 . 9 Å and the RMSD between B^Mtr4^I and B^FRH^I is 2 . 9 Å ( over 734 residues , B^for^I large cell B^FRH^I ) . 
 ( B ) SAXS data indicates that B^FRH^I - Δ114 is monomeric and flexible . The crystal structure of the large cell structure predicts the solution scattering curve ( left , χ2 = 0 . 92 ) and fits well to the calculated molecular envelope ( right ) . 
 ( A ) Comparison of the B^FRH^I N - terminus ( large cell structure , magenta ) to that of B^Mtr4^I ( green ) aligned on their RecA domains . Only the additional elements of B^FRH^I are shown ( cyan ) . The B^FRH^I N - terminal extension has little ordered secondary structure , although regions 143 - 147 and 129 - 135 form small turns that interact B^with^I the B^helicase^I core . ( B ) The very N - terminus of B^FRH^I extends away from the RecA - 2 domain to interact B^with^I a symmetry related molecule in the crystal ( below ) , whereas the B^Mtr4^I N - terminus turns back to form an outer β−strand . Center panel shows the crystal contacts , B^with^I close - B^ups^I B^for^I each region highlighted as insets on the left and right . 
 ( A ) The two RecA domains are rotated relative to one another in B^FRH^I ( cyan , large cell ) compared to B^Mtr4^I ( green , RNA backbone in orange ) . The change in positioning of RecA - 2 B^with^I respect to RecA - 1 results in an overall displacement from the B^Mtr4^I domain juxtaposition that ranges from 1 . 1 - 4 . 0 Å throughout RecA - 2 B^with^I the largest differences at the external helices . 
 ( B ) Comparison of B^arch^I domains conformations from B^Mtr4^I ( green ) and B^FRH^I ( large cell in cyan , small cell in marine ) after superposition of the most N - terminal helical region . The isolated KOW modules of B^FRH^I , B^Mtr4^I ( B^with^I B^FRH^I superimposed ) , and B^Ski2^I have considerably different loop configurations .

 ( A ) Key residues B^for^I B^FRH^I function shown on the large - cell structure : K208 and S324 compose the ATP binding site , E294 lies between the B^ADP^I and RNA pockets and participates in ATP hydrolysis ; P871 resides in the elbow region of the B^arch^I domain . K811 , R806 , R712 and K766 contribute to a positively charged surface on the KOW domain . R806H disrupts the B^clock^I .  ( A ) Race tube assays B^with^I B^FRH^I mutants . Every circadian cycle N . crassa lays down aerial hyphae that appear as fluffy yellow / orange conidial bands . The distance between the bands reflects the B^clock^I period . The strains were grown in constant darkness and growth fronts were labeled every 24 h ( black vertical lines ) , rhythmicity on right ( τ = period in hours , σ = standard deviation , n = number of race tubes , ARR , arrhythmic ) . The race tubes shown here are representative samples from three replicate tubes .
