Values B^for^I c - B^Jun^I were normalized to their respective 0 B^min^I time point ( n = 4 gels B^for^I each group performed blind ) . T - tests between similar time points were used to analyze results . 
 ( C ) B^PRR7^I , FBW7 and / or a control protein ( PSD95 ) were transfected into HEK293 cells and c - B^Jun^I ubiquitination B^was^I measured by immunoprecipitating c - B^Jun^I and blotting B^for^I ubiquitin . Ubiquitination of c - B^Jun^I in the presence of FBW7 ( 178 . 3 ± 26 . 9 % ) B^was^I significantly reduced in the presence of B^PRR7^I ( 103 . 7 ± 20 . 6 % ) B^but^I B^not^I a control protein ( PSD95 ) ( n = 5 gels B^for^I all groups ) . 
 ( D ) Western blots of c - B^Jun^I ubiquitination in hippocampal primary neuronal cultures . B^PRR7^I knockdown ( KD ) elevated ( 149±10 . 62 % , n = 6 gels ) c - B^Jun^I ubiquitination level in comparison to control neurons ( B^NT^I ) . Statistical significance B^was^I determined by t - test . 
 ( E ) Western blots showing knockdown ( KD ) or overexpression ( OE ) of B^PRR7^I in primary hippocampal neurons do B^not^I alter levels of other FBW7 targets B^mTOR^I or B^Myc^I . 
 ( A ) Co - IPs of B^PRR7^I B^with^I c - B^Jun^I from lysates of HEK293 cells overexpressing B^PRR7^I . 
 ( B ) Pulldown assays in vitro using purified proteins showed a direct interaction between B^PRR7^I and c - B^Jun^I . 
 ( C ) Co - IPs of B^PRR7^I B^with^I FBW7 from lysates of HEK293 cells overexpressing B^PRR7^I and FBW7 . 
 ( D ) Pulldown assays in vitro using purified B^PRR7^I and FBW7 . 
 ( E ) Co - IPs of endogenous B^PRR7^I and FBW7 from lysates of rat brain . 
 ( F ) Co - IPs of B^PRR7^I B^with^I c - B^Jun^I and FBW7 from lysates of HEK293 cells overexpressing B^PRR7^I and FBW7 . FBW7 expression increased the amount of c - B^Jun^I pulled down B^with^I B^PRR7^I ( n = 4 gels B^for^I each panel , representative blots ) . Lower B^bar^I graphs - quantitation B^for^I Western blots show c - B^Jun^I / FBW7 binding is 41 . 4±13 . 9 % greater in the presence of B^PRR7^I ( normalized B^for^I FBW7 expression ) . Similarly , c - B^Jun^I / B^PRR7^I binding is 97 . 4±38 . 1 % greater in the presence of FBW7 ( normalized B^for^I B^PRR7^I expression ) . Statistical significance B^was^I calculated using unpaired t - tests . 
 ( A ) Western blots of phospho - c - B^Jun^I in primary neuronal cultures . Quantification of phospho - c - B^Jun^I represents a ratio of phospho - c - B^Jun^I to total c - B^Jun^I and all ratios were normalized to B^NT^I . B^PRR7^I knockdown ( KD ) decreased , while B^PRR7^I overexpression ( OE ) increased phospho - c - B^Jun^I levels ( black bars ) . Glutamate stimulation ( gray bars ) increased phospho - c - B^Jun^I / c - B^Jun^I ratio in B^NT^I B^but^I B^not^I in KD or OE neurons ( n = 7 gels B^for^I all groups ) . Significance B^was^I determined using two - way ANOVA B^with^I Sidak B^post^I - B^hoc^I test . 
 ( B ) B^AP^I - 1 driven luciferase luminescence assays . B^PRR7^I expression in HEK293 cells increased B^AP^I - 1 activity ( 190 . 6 ± 13 . 9 % , n = 12 ; RLU = relative B^light^I units ) . Statistical significance B^was^I determined using t - tests . 
 ( D ) Quantitation of cell death using 30 minutes of PI in - situ staining following 48h of WT - B^PRR7^I - GFP or mNLS - B^PRR7^I - GFP overexpression in primary hippocampal neuronal cultures ( n = 24 cells B^per^I group ) . Images represent a B^max^I projection of five z - stack sections across the cell body . 
 ( E ) NMDA treatment ( 25 B^min^I , 100 µM followed by 14h chase ) caused 83 . 6±3 . 5 % cell death in control neurons compared to 60 . 3±4 . 6 % cell death in neurons B^with^I B^PRR7^I expression knocked down . A c - B^Jun^I inhibitory peptide reduced NMDA - mediated cell death to 66 . 2±6 . 0 % in control neurons and to 55 . 6±5 . 3 % in neurons knocked down B^for^I B^PRR7^I , B^but^I this difference B^was^I B^not^I statistically significant ( n = 5 independent experiments ) . Two - way ANOVA B^was^I used in conjugation B^with^I Tukey B^post^I - B^hoc^I test . ( Left ) Representative images showing transduced neurons ( green - GFP ) and PI staining ( B^red^I ) . 
 ( F ) Quantification of cell death in response to NMDA stimulation in the presence or absence of B^PRR7^I and either WT c - B^Jun^I or a dominant negative c - B^Jun^I 4A ( 4A ) . Overexpression of WT c - B^Jun^I caused extensive neuronal cell death ( 84 . 8±2 . 4 % ) that B^was^I reduced in neurons knocked down B^for^I B^PRR7^I ( 43 . 8±9 . 2 ) . Overexpressing 4A conferred neuroprotection to NMDA excitotoxicity ( 50 . 8±7 . 9 % ) B^but^I B^was^I B^not^I additive B^with^I B^PRR7^I knockdown ( 42 . 3±8 . 1 % ) ( n = 3 independent experiments ) . Significance B^was^I determined using two - way ANOVA in conjugation B^with^I Tukey B^post^I - B^hoc^I test . Images are representative 10X widefield micrographs showing transduced neurons ( green - GFP ) and PI staining ( B^red^I ) . Data is presented as mean±sem . All % values represent comparisons to control . 
B . Bimolecular fluorescence complementation between subunits of the Dsl complex and the COPI B^coat^I . The BiFC pair β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VC yielded fluorescent foci that showed dramatically reduced fluorescence intensity in the COPI binding - deficient dsl1 - 5xWA mutant . Schematic yeast cell representations depict the typical BiFC foci localization patterns . Scale B^bar^I 10 μm . 
C . Quantification of the β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VC BiFC signals in wild type cells and in COPI binding - deficient dsl1 - 5xWA and dsl1 - Δlasso mutants ( as shown exemplarily in ( B ) ) . Mean values + SEM of at least three independent experiments ( n = 3 - 8 ) are displayed . Statistical analysis B^was^I carried B^out^I by comparing the number of cells B^with^I BiFC signals over integrated thresholds to those without signals ( * = p < 0 , 05 ) . dsl1 mutant strains show a significant decrease in brightness , B^spot^I number and B^spot^I size in comparison B^with^I their corresponding B^DSL1^I wild type strains ( two - sample t - test ) . The dsl1 - 5xWA mutation also led to comparable signal reduction in cells carrying the VNI152L variant in the β ' - COP B^VN^I I152L• Dsl3p VC combination . 
D . Subcellular localization of different BiFC - tagged protein pairs . The Dsl1p VN• Dsl3p VC combination involving subunits of the B^ER^I - resident Dsl1 complex exhibited typical B^ER^I localization . Sec16p VN• Sec16p VC signals in a diploid heterozygous strain displayed an pattern typical B^for^I B^ER^I exit sites , while diploid cells carrying the α - COP VN• α - COP VC BiFC pair showed a Golgi - like fluorescence pattern . Scale B^bar^I 10 μm . 
E . The localization of COPI•Dsl BiFC foci compared to the autophagy marker Ape1p . Double fluorescence micrographs of the BiFC pair β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VC and the autophagy marker mRFP Ape1p are superimposed B^with^I the DIC image . BiFC - B^YFP^I signals are pseudocolored green . Fluorescent signals appeared distinct from each other . Also no co - localization B^was^I observed when we analyzed COPI•COPII ( Sec16p ) BiFC spots in cells expressing mRFP tagged B^APE1^I . Scale B^bar^I 10 µm . 
F . Growth effects of Venus fragment tags in dsl1 mutant cells . Serial tenfold dilutions of liquid cell cultures were spotted on agar plates and incubated at 30 °C B^for^I two days . The images in the second B^row^I show that β ' COP B^VN^I producing cells expressing the dsl1 - 5xWA mutation could B^not^I grow . The complementation of β ' COP B^VN^I by its cognate interaction partners Dsl1p VC and Dsl3p VC , B^but^I B^not^I by non - cognate BiFC partners ( Sec24p VC , Sec16p VC or VC Rer1p ) , suppressed these growth defects . Spot assays of exemplary BiFC partners are depicted . Asterisk : Dsl1p VC carrying the dsl1 - 5xWA defect B^was^I expressed from a plasmid . See Fig EV1 , EV2 and Appendix Fig S1 B^for^I full data display . 
G . BiFC signal quantifications of the strains presented in ( F ) . β ' - COP B^VN^I yielded BiFC fluorescence signals B^with^I all tested complementation partners . This rules B^out^I the possibility that the lack of suppression observed in F simply reflects the inability of the BiFC partners to form a complex , and shows that the successful complementation of the split - B^YFP^I fragments does B^not^I B^per^I se suppress the synthetic lethal effect of the B^VN^I B^tag^I in dsl1 - 5xWA cells . Mean values + SEM of at least three independent experiments ( n = 3 - 8 ) are displayed . 
I . Localization of Dsl1p B^CFP^I in β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VCcells . An overall B^ER^I localization of Dsl1p B^CFP^I B^was^I retained in β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VCcells , while some of the signal B^was^I found in the foci . BiFC - B^YFP^I signals are pseudocolored B^red^I . Scale B^bar^I 10 µm . 
A . Dsl1p VN• ε - COP VC BiFC signal localization pattern throughout the budding cycle . B^Time^I - lapse images of agarose - embedded cells were recorded at RT B^with^I continuous PM Glc + ura medium supply . Arrowheads mark positions of BiFC foci . Fluorescence signals exhibited a characteristic and reproducible localization pattern , which favored sites of high material turnover during budding . Scale B^bar^I 10 µm . 
B . Dsl1p VN• ε - COP VC BiFC foci showed different subcellular distribution depending on the growth status of cells . Cells were cultured in PM + ura medium B^with^I or without 2 % glucose at 30 °C B^for^I 90 B^min^I , and imaged . BiFC signals dispersed under glucose starvation , resulting in an B^ER^I exit site - like fluorescence pattern . Scale B^bar^I 10 µm . 
C . The effect of carbon source depletion on COPI•Dsl BiFC signal polarization . Cells carrying Dsl1p VN• ε - COP VC were starved in glucose - free PM + ura medium B^for^I 90 B^min^I . Then the medium B^was^I replaced by PM Glc + ura B^with^I 2 % glucose , while imaging the cells continuously at 1 B^min^I intervals . Two exemplary cells are shown ( upper and lower panel ) . Starvation - induced dispersed BiFC signals reversibly returned to polarized distribution within minutes after addition of glucose - containing medium . Arrowheads mark the point of signal repolarization , arrows indicate resumed bud outgrowth . Scale B^bar^I 5 µm . 
D . βʼ - COP VN• Dsl3p VC BiFC signals during mating . Fluorescence micrographs of the BiFC pair β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VC ( green ) are superimposed B^with^I the DIC image ( grey ) . Two haploid strains carrying βʼ - COP VN• Dsl3p VC were allowed to mate in YEPD liquid culture B^for^I 2 h at 30 °C . Then time - lapse recordings were made in agarose embedding at RT B^with^I continuous PM Glc + ura medium supply . Arrowheads mark positions of BiFC foci . Fluorescence signals exhibited a characteristic and reproducible localization at sites of high material turnover during zygote formation . Scale B^bar^I 10 µm . 
E . Comparison of the BiFC localization pattern in COPI•Dsl and COPI•COPI strains . B^Time^I - lapse images of agarose - embedded cells carrying the COPI•Dsl BiFC pair βʼ - COP VN• Dsl3p VC or the COPI•COPI BiFC pair βʼ - COP VN• α - COP VC were recorded at RT B^with^I continuous PM Glc + ura medium supply at 5 B^min^I intervals . Single cell pseudokymographs were generated by concatenating the central section of the cell ( sliced along the B^pole^I axis , frames at B^double^I the width of the bud neck ) of a time - lapse dataset . The COPI•Dsl strain showed one single dominant B^spot^I at the bud B^tip^I and later the bud neck . In contrast , the COPI•COPI strain additionally exhibited multiple spots B^with^I no apparent polarization tendency , which were localized mainly in the mother cell . Schematic yeast cell representations depict the typical BiFC foci localization pattern of the strains . Scale B^bar^I 10 µm . 
F . Fluorescence recovery after photobleaching of BiFC signals . B^Time^I - lapse images of agarose - embedded cells carrying the β ' - COP VN• Dsl3p VC BiFC pair were recorded at RT B^with^I PM Glc + ura medium supply at 2 B^min^I intervals . Fluorescence of ROIs marked in dashed lines ( where the full cell , full bud , or only the bud foci were bleached ) were depleted by three repetitions of fluorescence excitation at 177 µs / pixel and 100 % laser intensity . Arrowheads : reappearing fluorescence signal ; scale B^bar^I 2 µm . G . Densitometric measurements of fluorescence intensities in photobleached cells . Representative data sets from five independent experiments are displayed , featuring cells that B^had^I been bleached entirely ( black lines ) , at the bud only ( dark B^blue^I lines ) , or at the fluorescent foci at the bud B^tip^I only ( B^light^I B^blue^I line ) . Values are displayed in percentage of initial fluorescence , and were corrected B^for^I photobleaching effects by normalization against fluorescence of unbleached cells . Fluorescence recovery B^was^I typically B^not^I continued to full recovery stage because of the photobleaching artefacts occurring during long - B^term^I imaging of the samples .

Other exons are numbered according to their orders in the common isoforms . Due to space limitation , some canonical exons presented in both the common and SATS isoforms are omitted and represented by " / / " . Numbers in parenthesis represent the abundance rank of SATS isoforms .

A . Distribution of repeat elements around the transcription start site ( B^TSS^I ) regions of the SATS isoforms ( SATS ) , common isoforms ( common ) and RefSeq genes ( RefSeq ) . The Y - axis represents the proportion of isoforms ( or genes ) B^with^I each type of repeat element around their transcription start site regions . B^LTR^I , Long Terminal Repeat ; SINE , Short Interspersed Nuclear Element ; LINE , Long Interspersed Element ; S _ R , Simple Repeat ; L _ C , B^Low^I Complexity region ; others , other types of repeats ; B^NA^I , without repeat sequence . 
B . Expression comparison of the SATS isoforms ( SATS ) , common isoforms ( common ) and Refseq genes ( Refseq ) in mESCs . The Y - axis represents the log2 transformed average FPKM values of each isoform or gene in three mESC lines ( F145 , F146 and F147 ) . The FPKM values in each cell line B^was^I calculated by the reads mapped to the first exon and normalized by the exon length . Red dots represent the mean expression level of isoforms or gene in each group . The SATS and common isoforms from the same gene are connected by grey lines . 
C . Expression comparison of SATS genes in mESCs and somatic cells . The X - axis and Y - axis represent the log2 transformed average FPKM values of each gene of three mESC lines ( F145 , F146 and F147 ) and three somatic cell lines ( ADSC , NSC , TTF ) , respectively . Big B^red^I dots , B^blue^I dots , yellow small dots represent SATS genes B^with^I > 2 - fold expression difference and p - value < 0 . 05 ( Two - tailed Student ' s t test ) , SATS genes B^with^I < 2 - fold expression changes , and other genes B^with^I > 2 - fold expression difference and p - value < 0 . 05 ( Two - tailed Student ' s t test ) between mESCs and somatic cells , respectively . R represents the Pearson correlation coefficient of gene expression between mESCs and somatic cells . 
D . Relationship between nucleotide and amino acid changes of the mESC - specific SATS isoforms as compared to corresponding common isoforms . Plus values represent nucleotide / amino acid expansions in the SATS isoforms , minus values represent nucleotide / amino acid deletions . The B^top^I and right boxplots are the quantile plots of nucleotide changes or amino acid changes , respectively . Black bars within the quantile box represent the median of changes .

B . Positive hits were validated by semi - quantitative qPCR in B^ant^I - 132 - injected mouse hippocampus . Black line indicates mean of scramble control B^set^I to 1 . Dashed line indicates chosen threshold of 1 . 3 - fold . Sample size , n = 9 B^per^I group . Values were normalized to scramble - injected group and presented as mean ± SEM .

 ( C ) BN - PAGE analyses of OXPHOS mitochondrial complexes in fibroblasts from control and subject , overexpressing an B^HA^I - tagged version of wild - type B^SLC25A46^I .  ( B ) MCF10A cells were stimulated B^with^I B^EGF^I ( 10 ng / ml ) B^for^I up to eight hours . The heatmaps depict lncRNAs ( left ) and mRNAs ( right ) B^for^I which a > 1 . 5 - fold ( lncRNAs ) or a > 2 - fold ( mRNA ) change in expression B^was^I observed in at least one of the time points , compared to un - stimulated cells ( time zero ) . Note that each B^row^I of the heatmap represents an individual lncRNAs / mRNAs , and values ( see color scale at the bottom ) indicate the log2 ratio of RNA levels between each time point and time zero .

 ( A ) Schematic representation of the annotated RefSeq gene models of LIMT ( B^NR^I _ 002809 ; chromosome 12q24 . 31 ) and the neighboring protein - coding genes ( B^RHOF^I and B^SETD1B^I ) . Arrows denote direction of transcription ( note that LIMT resides on the minus strand ) . Also shown is the distribution of evolutionary conservation along the sequence of LIMT across 100 vertebrate species . Note that the 5 ' region of LIMT is highly conserved ( green rectangle ) . Promoter - associated histone methylation ( B^H3^I K4Me3 ) and acetylation ( B^H3^I K27Ac3 ) were obtained in MCF7 and MCF10A cells , respectively ( see Methods ) . Acetylation signals were obtained B^for^I MCF10A cells stimulated B^with^I B^EGF^I B^for^I 20 minutes ( green ) , or un - stimulated ( black ; overlaying histogram ) . Note that stimulation B^with^I B^EGF^I caused a decrease in acetylation at the promoter region ( B^red^I rectangle ) . 
 ( B ) Expression of LIMT B^was^I determined in a panel of 44 cancer and non - cancer cell lines using real - time qPCR . Expression levels were normalized to the B^GAPDH^I transcript and presented in arbitrary units . N , non - cancer cell line . 
The expression of LIMT is shown relative to ( A ) PAM50 subtypes ( N = 381 patients ) , ( B ) tumor grade ( N = 309 ) , ( C ) B^HER2^I status ( N = 309 ) and ( D ) B^ER^I status ( N = 381 patients ) . Expression of individual lncRNAs B^was^I determined in tumors from breast cancer patients of the Oslo2 study using Agilent arrays . Molecular subtypes of the corresponding tumors were determined by using the PAM50 classifier . The Student ' s t - test B^was^I applied to evaluate differences in lncRNA expression between two groups . To evaluate differences in expression among three or more groups , we applied one - way analysis of variance ( ANOVA ) .

D . Mitochondrial depolarization upon AICD induction B^was^I analysed in cells treated as indicated . Data represent mean ± B^SE^I of five independent experiments . 
E . Protein samples ( 20μg ) from Jurkat cells treated as indicated were separated by B^SDS^I - PAGE and immunoblotted B^with^I the indicated antibodies . WB are representative of three independent experiments . F . Quantitative analysis of the ratio between the protein levels of mitochondrial markers and GRP75 during AICD is shown . Data represent mean ± B^SE^I of three independent experiments . 
A . Scheme of the reporter library which includes random fragments of the transcriptome in the B^CDS^I . Transcripts share the same 5 ' and 3 ' UTR and 26 within the translation start site , which are recognized by a specific translation blocking morpholino ( MO ) ( green ) . I , illumina adapters , purple . B^SP6^I , B^SP6^I promoter . mRNAs are injected at the one cell stage in zebrafish and Xenopus , B^with^I or without a translation blocking morpholino . Reporter mRNA library is analyzed 8 - 9 hours B^post^I injection using high throughput sequencing . The analysis of variance ( ANOVA ) B^for^I the occurrence of each codon in the presence ( - MO ) or the absence ( + MO ) of translation is performed between triplicates in zebrafish and Xenopus to calculate the reporter Codon Stabilizing Index ( rCSI ) . If codons cause differential mRNA stability in a translation dependent manner , potential stabilizing codons should be enriched in translated mRNAs ( - MO vs + MO ) ( + rCSI ) , and destabilizing codons depleted ( - MO vs + MO ) ( - rCSI ) . B . Boxplots showing the occurrence of the GGU and the B^CAC^I codons in the presence ( + MO ) and absence of MO in the reporter mRNA library 8 hours B^post^I injection ( hpi ) ( triplicates ) . C . Biplots of the reporter codon stabilizing index ( rCSI ) in the presence and the absence of translation ( + MO ) in zebrafish and in Xenopusembryos , P < 2 . 2e - 16 R = 0 . 9 , Spearman rank correlation . The rCSI is the ANOVA F - test value B^for^I the comparison of codon occurrences ( e . g , panel B ) between treatments in triplicates . This value is multiplied by - 1 B^for^I depleted / destabilizing codons . 
E . B^Line^I plots of the relative demand of each codon in the zebrafish transcriptome at 6 B^hpf^I ( % used ) , and the RNA levels B^for^I each B^tRNA^I ( B^RPM^I ) . The P - value indicates the significant correlation B^with^I the B^CSC^I . 
F . Biplots of the rCSI comparing 8h vs 8h + MO and B^CSC^I in Zebrafishembryos , P < 1 . 2e - 4 R = 0 . 4 , Spearman rank correlation . Based on the consistent identification by both methods we defined : Optimal codons , highlighted in B^red^I and non - optimal codons in B^blue^I . The intensity of the color represents the strength ( B^light^I , weak ; dark , strong ) based on different B^CSC^I values . G . Boxplot of B^tRNA^I levels ( B^RPM^I ) B^for^I optimal and non - optimal codons ( P = 3e - 03 , Wilcoxon rank - sum test ) . 
H . Cumulative distributions of the half - life of the maternal mRNAs in the absence of zygotic transcription in zebrafish . Shown are all mRNAs ( gray ) , mRNAs B^with^I the highest fraction ( B^top^I quartile ) of optimal codons and the lowest fraction of non - optimal codons ( B^red^I ) , mRNAs B^with^I the highest fraction of non - optimal codons and the lowest fraction of optimal codons ( B^blue^I ) , in frame ( left ) or 1 nucleotide B^out^I of frame + 1 ( right ) . ( P = 1e - 8 , in frame ; P = 0 . 13 , 1 nt B^out^I of frame , Wilcoxon rank - sum test ) . 
I . Diagram of two transcripts that only differ in a single nucleotide ( G in yellow ) which creates a frame shift , making one transcript enriched in optimal codons , and the other in non - optimal codons . B^Time^I - course northern B^blot^I shows that non - optimal transcripts decay faster than their optimal counterparts . The radioactive intensity is shown in italics and normalized to the 1hpi sample B^for^I each injection . 
B . Cumulative distributions of mRNA fold change ( 6 - 2 h ) in wild - type embryos , embryos injected B^with^I α - amanitin , and embryos treated B^with^I the translation elongation inhibitor cycloheximide . The different curves represent transcripts : enriched in non - optimal codons ( B^top^I quartile , B^blue^I ) , containing at least one miR - 430 complementary site ( 6 - , 7 - or 8 - B^mer^I ) ( green ) , enriched in optimal codons ( B^top^I quartile , B^red^I ) and a control B^set^I of maternal genes that do B^not^I follow any of the described criteria ( gray ) . P - values are indicated B^for^I the comparisons shown B^with^I the colored dots ( Wilcoxon rank - sum test ) . 
C . qRT - B^PCR^I analysis B^for^I predicted optimal ( B^red^I ) and non - optimal ( B^blue^I ) transcripts relative to the controls ( B^cdk2ap2^I and B^taf15^I ) . IK Cytokine , constitutive Heat Shock protein 90 ( hsp90ab ) , B^tRNA^I methyltransferase 12 homolog ( B^trmt12^I ) and Hermansky - Pudlak B^syndrome^I 4 ( B^hps4^I ) . Results are shown as the average expression ± S . D . M . from three biological replicates ( B^top^I panel ) and six biological replicates ( bottom panel ) . ( Mo , embryos were injected B^with^I a morpholino complementary to the translation start site of the endogenous mRNA ) . * = p < 0 . 0001 compared to 2h . * = p < 0 . 005 compared to uninjected embryos . 
D . Schematic representing the maternal mRNA decay dynamics and the transcript groups analyzed . E . Barplot representing relative codon distributions between the most unstable ( quartile ) and the most stable ( quartile , n = 1458 ) maternal mRNAs in wild type , α - amanitin , and cycloheximide ( CHX ) treated embryos . Codons were sorted by their B^CSC^I value ( Fig 1D ) . P - values are indicated B^for^I the comparisons between enrichment / depletion in each condition and B^CSC^I ( Spearman rank test ) . Optimal codons were highlighted in B^red^I and non - optimal in B^blue^I ( B^light^I , weak ; dark , strong , as Fig 1F ) . Note the depletion of optimal ( B^red^I ) and enrichment of non - optimal ( B^blue^I ) codons in unstable mRNAs in wild - type and α - amanitin treated embryos B^but^I B^not^I in CHX treated embryos , consistent B^with^I a translation - mediated mechanism of maternal mRNA decay through codon optimality . 
C - F . Cumulative distributions of mRNA fold change B^for^I optimal ( B^red^I ) , non - optimal ( B^blue^I ) , and control transcripts across zebrafish ( C ) , Xenopus ( D ) , mouse ( E ) and Drosophila ( F ) . 
G - J . Codon enrichment / depletion between the most unstable ( quartile ) and the most stable ( quartile , n = 1500 ) maternal mRNAs during the MZT in zebrafish ( G ) , Xenopus ( H ) , mouse ( I ) and Drosophila ( J ) . Most optimal codons ( B^red^I : B^light^I , weak ; dark , strong ) are depleted and non - optimal ( B^blue^I : B^light^I , weak ; dark , strong ) codons are enriched in unstable mRNAs compared to stable ones . P - values are indicated B^for^I the comparisons between enrichment / depletion in each species and codon optimality defined in zebrafish ( B^CSC^I ) ( Spearman rank test ) . 
B . Heatmap showing the codon expression bias across the transcriptome B^for^I different developmental time points ( 2 , 6 , 12 , 24 and 48 B^hpf^I ) and adult organs in zebrafish , and Xenopus at 48h ( right ) . The codon optimality , and B^CSC^I calculated during embryogenesis is shown to the right ( B^red^I , optimal to B^blue^I , non - optimal ) . Heatmap shows the correlation of codon occurrence and Xenopus mRNA expression at 48 h . On the left a heat B^map^I ( Red - Blue ) shows the B^CSC^I values B^for^I zebrafish and Xenopus . The codons are sorted by their B^CSC^I values . B^For^I most tissues , optimal codons are correlated B^with^I highly expressed genes ( orange ) , while non - optimal codons are anticorrelated B^with^I high levels of expression ( purple ) . We also observe a correlation between mRNA expression and the B^CSC^I across different samples ( 2h P = 1e - 07 R = 0 . 6 , 6h P = 2e - 16 R = 0 . 7 , 12h P = 3e - 09 R = 0 . 6 , 24h P = 2e - 07 R = 0 . 6 , 48h P = 1e - 07 R = 0 . 6 , Brain P = 1e - 04 R = 0 . 4 , TestisP = 1e - 07 R = 0 . 6 , Liver P = 1e - 03 R = 0 . 4 , Spearman rank test ) .

B . Single nucleotide resolution electrophoresis B^for^I B^poly^I ( A ) B^tail^I length B^for^I two sets of transcripts that only differ in a single nucleotide insertion ( " G " ) , B^but^I contain opposite codon optimality due to a change in the reading frame ( Fig 1I ) . 
E . Fluorescent microscopy images of representative embryos at 24hpf expressing a bicistronic reporter encoding an optimal or non - optimal coding sequence followed by a B^cis^I - acting hydrolase elements ( B^P2A^I ; CHYSEL ) and GFP . B^P2A^I causes ribosome skipping , what allows us to use GFP as a readout of the translation of the upstream polypeptide . dsRed mRNA is co - injected as a control and it is shown below . The level of GFP is higher in the optimal reporter ( B^hsp90^I ) than the non - optimal one ( B^hps4^I ) . Immunofluorescence B^was^I performed B^with^I endo - lysosomal organelle markers ( B^top^I panel : B^EEA1^I , middle panel : B^Vamp3^I and B^Lamp1^I : bottom panel ) and revealed that α - synuclein fibrils co - localized B^with^I lysosomal vesicles ( see arrow ) ; in B^red^I : α - synuclein fibrils , in green : organelle markers and in B^blue^I : nuclei . Scale B^bar^I represents 10 μm , arrows pinpoint assemblies co - localizing B^with^I organelle markers . The B^bar^I graph at the bottom shows the quantification of the percentage of co - localization of α - synuclein fibrils B^with^I organelle markers , revealing that α - synuclein puncta co - localized mostly B^with^I lysosomal vesicles . Data show mean ± s . e . m . from three independent experiments . 
 ( D ) Representative confocal pictures of control cells loaded B^with^I ATTO - 550 α - synuclein fibrils and LysoTracker Deep Red ( B^top^I panel ) , and of donor ( middle panel ) and acceptor GFP - transfected acceptor cells ( bottom panel , GFP - vector B^not^I shown ) cells , loaded B^with^I α - synuclein fibrilsATTO - 550 and LysoTracker Deep Red ( middle panel ) and co - cultured B^for^I 24 hours ; in B^red^I : α - synuclein fibrils , in green : LysoTracker Deep Red and in B^blue^I : nuclei . Scale B^bar^I represents 10 μm , arrows in inset pinpoint fibrils co - localizing B^with^I LysoTracker positive vesicles . ( E ) The percentage of co - localization of LysoTracker positive vesicles B^with^I α - synuclein fibrils revealed that 80 % of lysosomal vesicles that transferred from donor to acceptor cells contained α - synuclein fibrils thus demonstrating direct transfer of α - synuclein fibrils from donor to acceptor cells in majority inside lysosomal vesicles derived from donor cells . Data show mean ± s . e . m . from three independent experiments . 
 ( A ) Representative images of control ( upper panel ) and α - synuclein loaded neurons ( middle , 0 . 5µM , and bottom , 1µM , panels ) after 16 h . In B^red^I : α - synuclein fibrils , in green : B^MAP^I - 2 and in B^blue^I : nuclei . Scale B^bar^I represents 10 μm .

In B^red^I : α - synuclein fibrils , in green : CTG , in B^white^I : B^MAP^I - 2 / B^Lamp1^I and in B^blue^I : nuclei . Scale B^bar^I represents 5 μm . ( C ) The graph B^bar^I shows the percentage of donor ( B^white^I B^bar^I ) and acceptor ( black B^bar^I ) neurons containing α - synuclein puncta . Data show mean ± s . e . m . ( D ) The box plot depicts the number of puncta in donor ( B^white^I ) and acceptor ( grey ) neurons . ( E ) Box plot showing the distribution of the average size of α - synuclein puncta in donor ( B^white^I ) and acceptor ( grey ) neurons . ( F ) The graph B^bar^I represents the percentage of α - synuclein puncta co - localized B^with^I lysosomes in donor ( B^white^I ) and acceptor ( black ) neurons . Data show mean ± s . e . m . Graphs in C , D , E and F correspond to data from 3 independent experiments analysed after 72 hours of co - culture ( * * * * , p < 0 . 0001 compared to donor by two - tailed Mann Whitney test ) . 
 ( B ) Representative images of acceptor neurons that were either ( i ) co - cultured B^with^I donor neurons ( upper panel , Co - culture ) , ( ii ) physically separated from donor cells ( middle panel , No contact ) or ( iii ) cultured B^with^I the conditioned medium of donor neurons ( bottom panel , B^CM^I ) . In B^red^I : α - synuclein fibrils , in B^white^I : acceptor neurons and in B^blue^I : nuclei . Scale B^bar^I represents 10 μm .

Data show mean ± s . e . m from 3 independent experiments . ( D ) The box plot shows the number of α - synuclein puncta in acceptor neurons in co - culture ( B^white^I ) , in B^CM^I ( grey ) and in the No contact condition ( B^light^I grey ) . * * * * , p < 0 . 001 compared to the co - culture condition by two - tailed Mann Whitney test ( n = 3 independent experiments ) . .

A , Heat B^map^I of all reported cancer blood metabolites ( each dark B^blue^I mark denotes that the metabolite B^was^I reported to be increased or decreased ) in various cancer types , illustrating that most individual studies report only a small subset of all previously measured metabolites . It is typically B^not^I described whether the metabolites that were B^not^I reported ( B^white^I " empty " space ) were B^not^I measured , or measured B^but^I B^not^I reported . Labelings : X - axis ( B^top^I ) : ribbon colour code , denoting the cancer type ( right ; indicated by B^red^I arrow ) ; X - axis ( bottom ) : cohorts , arranged from 1 to 71 ; Y - axis ( right ) : all 1 , 206 metabolites reported in at least one of the studies ; Y - axis ( left ) : ribbon colour code , denoting the metabolite class ( amino acids , carbohydrates , etc ; " other " refers to all other metabolites than the listed classes ) . 
B , Vote counting of cancer blood metabolites ( reported in at least six cohorts ) showed consistently deregulated metabolites . Blue bars : decreased metabolites ; B^red^I bars : increased metabolites . * ( asterisk ) in front of the name of the metabolite indicates a statistical trend ( p < 0 . 1 ) ; B^red^I arrowheads denote metabolites mentioned in the main text . 
C , D , Volcano plot of bloodmetabolites ( C ) and tissuemetabolites ( D ) , reported in at least six cancer studies , B^with^I the vote counting score on the X - axis and the - log10 adjusted p - value on the Y - axis . Cyan indicates deregulated metabolites that show a trend ( p < 0 . 1 ; B^for^I blood , corresponding to metabolites marked B^with^I * in panel 2B ; B^for^I tissue , corresponding to metabolites marked B^with^I * in Figure 3 ) or statistical significance ( p < 0 . 05 ; above black dashed horizontal line ) ; B^red^I indicates metabolites B^with^I a p - value > 0 . 1 . A subset of metabolites is annotated ( see Table EV4 ( blood ) and EV5 ( tissue ) B^for^I full annotation ) . 
Vote counting of cancer tissue metabolites ( reported in at least six cohorts ) showed consistently deregulated metabolites . Blue bars : decreased metabolites ; B^red^I bars : increased metabolites . * ( asterisk ) in front of the name of the metabolite indicates a statistical trend ( p < 0 . 1 ) ; B^red^I arrows denote B^key^I metabolites mentioned in the main text ( see Table EV5 B^for^I full annotation ) .

Data are displayed as mean ± SEM and analyzed by Student ' s t - test . Scalebar 100 µm . A ) Capture - C from hypoxicMCF - 7 cells ( B^top^I ) and ChIP - B^seq^I tracks B^for^I subunits of HIF , B^H3^I K4me1 , B^H3^I K27ac , B^CTCF^I and RNAseq in normoxic and hypoxicMCF - 7 cells as indicated at the B^ARRDC3^I ( arrestin domain containing 3 ) and B^LUCAT1^I ( lung cancer associated transcript 1 - non - protein coding ) gene loci . Interaction B^with^I the B^TSS^I of both B^LUCAT1^I and B^ARRDC3^I is highlighted in B^blue^I . Association B^with^I regions including additional enhancers , are highlighted in green . B ) Regions associated B^with^I HIF - binding sites were classified according to the presence of a UCSC annotated B^TSS^I , or coincidence B^with^I B^H3^I K4me1 or B^H3^I K4me3 ChIP - B^seq^I signal . The B^bar^I chart shows the average number of each type of site that interacted B^per^I HIF - binding site . D ) Genes at which the B^TSS^I interacted B^with^I a HIF - binding site and E ) genes adjacent to HIF - binding sites , which B^did^I B^not^I interact B^with^I the site were subjected to GSEA using a ranking metric combining fold - change in hypoxia and significance [ 25 ] . The ranking metric on the horizontal axis is shown as a color scale at the bottom . All the genes whose promoters were associated B^with^I HIF - binding sites appeared amongst the most strongly hypoxia - induced genes , whilst non - interacting genes showed no enrichment .

D . Subcellular localization analysis of LincGET and Dyei by RNA fractionation and B^TM^I - qPCR analysis . The results show that LincGET and Dyei locate in the nucleus and are mainly associated to chromatin . The error bars represent s . e . m . B^Chro^I , chromosome . B^Nuc^I , nucleoplasm . About 500 early 4 - cell embryos were used B^for^I each experiment and three experimental replicates were performed . 
E . miRNA reverse northern B^blot^I B^for^I LincGET and Dyei . miRNAs were isolated and amplified by RT - B^PCR^I after adding B^double^I adaptors , then southern B^blot^I ( reverse northern ) B^was^I performed . It shows no evidence of small RNA products , indicating that LincGET and Dyei do B^not^I function as B^pre^I - miRNA . The miR1982 B^was^I used as a miRNA positive control . About 400 early 4 - cell embryos were used B^for^I each experiment and three experimental replicates were performed .

G . RNA - FISH in early 2 - to 16 - cell embryos B^for^I LincGET and Dyei . The results show that LincGET is present in the nucleus of late 2 - to 4 - cell embryos and weakly expressed in early 8 - cell embryos , while Dyei is present in the nucleus of 2 - to 4 - cell embryos . B . LNA efficiently mediated LincGET knockdown . LNA B^was^I injected at phCG 25 hours and embryos were collected at phCG 48 hours at late 2 - cell stage B^for^I B^TM^I - qPCR analysis . C . LincGET depleted embryos arrest at the 2 - cell stage . LNA B^was^I injected at phCG 25 hours and photos were taken at phCG 114 hours at the late blastocyst stage . Embryos injected B^with^I Control - LNA B^can^I develop to the late blastocyst stage , while LincGET depleted embryos arrest at the 2 - cell stage . Scale B^bar^I , 100 μm . At least three experimental replicates were performed B^for^I each LNA injection ( Table 1 ) . 
D . LincGET depletion results in developmental arrest at the B^G2^I phase of 2 - cell stage without affecting DNA integrity and replication . We use BrdU to visualize S and B^G2^I phases , B^CAF^I - 1 to visualize S phase , and PI to visualize the M phase . B^Cyclin^I B^B1^I is a marker of B^G2^I stage and B^H2A^I . X is a marker of DNA damage . Aphidicolin - treated embryos arrest at the S phase without DNA replication . LNA B^was^I injected at phCG 25 hours and embryos were collected at phCG 48 hours at the late 2 - cell stage B^for^I B^IF^I analysis . Scale B^bar^I , 50 μm . Three experimental replicates were performed and about 15 embryos were used in each group . 
E . EU staining indicates the normal major ZGA process after LincGET depletion . EU B^was^I added to the culture medium at phCG 40 hours and EU signals were detected at phCG 48 hours . Scale B^bar^I , 50 μm . Three experimental replicates were performed and about 15 embryos were used in each group .

A . RT - B^PCR^I results showed that B^hnRNP U^I , B^FUBP1^I , and B^ILF2^I promote exon 3 skipping of B^Cdk1^I . We injected Control - LNA or LincGET - LNA2 together B^with^I siRNA B^for^I either Egfp , B^Hnrnpu^I , B^Fubp1^I , or B^Ilf2^I or Control - LNA together B^with^I mRNA B^for^I either one of them at the pronuclear stage ( 12 groups ) and assessed B^Cdk1^I and B^Cdk1^I - 3ExS levels at the late 2 - cell stage ( phCG 48 hours ) . B^For^I each lane , about 50 embryos were used . Three experimental replicates were performed . The results show that knockdown of either of B^Hnrnpu^I , B^Fubp1^I , or B^Ilf2^I , B^but^I B^not^I Egfp in the presence of LincGET B^had^I no effect on exon 3 skipping of B^Cdk1^I ( left 4 lanes ) . Knockdown of either B^Hnrnpu^I , B^Fubp1^I , or B^Ilf2^I , B^but^I B^not^I Egfp in absence of LincGET decreased the B^Cdk1^I - 3ExS level ( middle 4 lanes ) , especially si - B^Fubp1^I . Overexpression of B^Hnrnpu^I , B^Fubp1^I , or B^Ilf2^I , B^but^I B^not^I Egfp in the presence of LincGET promoted exon 3 skipping of B^Cdk1^I ( right 4 lanes ) , especially B^Fubp1^I . The band intensities were quantitated and are shown under the gel image . Two tailed student ' s t - test B^was^I used B^for^I the statistical analysis and different letters ( a - d ) mean p < 0 . 05 . si - , siRNA . OE - , overexpression .

Comparison of constitutively active B^rhodopsin^I mutants M257Y6 . 40 ( left [ 21 ] ) , T94I2 . 61 ( middle ) and G90D2 . 57 ( right [ 16 ] ) . All - trans ( yellow ) and B^cis^I retinal isomers ( orange ) , the B^side^I of retinal attachment K2967 . 43 ( B^blue^I slate ) , the retinal counterion E1133 . 28 ( B^blue^I slate ) , GαCT peptides ( cyan ) and the constitutively activating mutations M257Y6 . 40 , T94I2 . 61 , and G90D2 . 57 ( green ) are shown as spheres . Palmitoylation at C323H8 and glycosylation at N15NT are shown as sticks . The lower panels compare the M257Y6 . 40 , T94I2 . 61 and G90D2 . 57 retinal - binding pockets . All constructs also contain an additional thermostabilizing disulfide bridge , depicted as ( c - c ) , to enhance the stability [ 18 ] and crystallizability [ 19 ] without changing the B^rhodopsin^I activation pathway [ 20 ] . 
Kinetic characterization of the B^rhodopsin^I dark state . Thermal decay of dark state B^rhodopsin^I : A ) WT , B ) T94I and C ) G90D B^rhodopsin^I . The spectra are normalized to the OD280 and OD500 / OD480 at t = 0 . D ) Absorption maximum plotted as a function of time and fitted to a single exponential decay . 
Retinal isomerization in the B^rhodopsin^I dark state : E ) WT , F ) T94I and G ) G90D B^rhodopsin^I , H ) The fraction of 11 - B^cis^I retinal is plotted as a function of time and fitted to a single exponential decay . 
SB stability in dark state B^rhodopsin^I : I ) WT , J ) T94I and K ) G90D B^rhodopsin^I . L ) OD440 is plotted as a function of time and fitted to a single exponential decay . All decay rates were measured at 55 C . 
Accelerated molecular dynamic simulation of the B^rhodopsin^I dark state : WT , G90D2 . 57 , T94I2 . 61 and T94I2 . 61 B^with^I protonated E1133 . 28 . In the absence of the G90D2 . 57 and T94I2 . 61 dark state structure , both aspartate and isoleucine were placed in the WT ( 1GZM [ 48 ] ) using a favorable rotamer without introducing major clashes B^with^I the B^rest^I of the protein . However , both isoleucine and aspartate in the dark state structures introduced clashes B^with^I several amino acids and were therefore optimized using energy minimization before simulation . WT simulation B^was^I done B^with^I the protonated SB while in the G90D2 . 57 system , both E1133 . 28 and SB were protonated [ 36 ] . The protonated state of E1133 . 28 B^was^I unknown in T94I2 . 61 , therefore simulation were done B^for^I both deprotonated and protonated E1133 . 28 . The T94I2 . 61 dark state conformation B^with^I deprotonated E1133 . 28 B^was^I similar to that of the WT and B^was^I stable , whereas the dark state of G90D2 . 57 and T94I2 . 61 B^with^I protonated E1133 . 28 B^was^I unstable B^with^I a concomitant movement of E1133 . 28 residue away from the SB , thereby , causing movement of TM3 and opening of the E1133 . 28 - SB activation switch . In contrast to the crystal structures the orientation of the retinal - ionone ring in the simulations B^was^I variable B^with^I respect to the polyene chain . This indicates a degree of positional freedom within the hydrophobic binding pocket .

Expected log2 ( H / M ) values based on equation 4 are plotted as B^light^I B^blue^I lines . B^For^I Sre2 B^MS^I mutants showing defects in cleavage , the average fold - increase in P level in B^dsc1^I Δ cells compared to WT cells from two isolates ( Appendix Fig B^S2^I ) B^was^I plotted . Recombinant proteins B^GST^I - fused Rbd2 C - terminus ( Rbd2 200 - 251 ) , Dsc5 UBX ( Dsc5 323 - 425 ) , B^Dsc2^I B^UBA^I ( B^Dsc2^I 298 - 372 ) , and B^GST^I - B^HA^I - V5 control were bound to B^GST^I magnetic beads and incubated B^with^I S . pombe cytosol fraction from wild - type cells . D . Single residue mutants of conserved glycine residues in Rbd2 200 - 251 ( G244R and G246R ) were tested B^for^I Cdc48 binding as in ( C ) . Western blots ( B - D ) were imaged using chemiluminescence .

H ) B^ERG^I B^was^I used to assess retinal function in response to large - field flash stimuli under both scotopic and photopic conditions . B ) Summary table of experimental binding affinities of the parental components targeting B^VEGF^I - A ( ranibizumab ) and B^ANG^I - 2 ( LC10 ) as well as of RG7716 measured by isothermal titration calorimetry . RG7716 binds B^VEGF^I - A 121 and - 165 B^with^I an affinity comparable to ranibizumab ( 3 . 3 vs . 3 . 1 nM ) . All three components are needed as heparin / anti - B^VEGF^I - A alone does B^not^I activate platelet aggregation . B Hematoxylin and eosin staining ( H&E ) of skeletal muscle from patient II . 1 shows histological features of moderate to severe dystrophic pattern . ( Scale B^bar^I , 50 μm ) . 
C B^T1^I - weighted MRI axial images at thigh and calf levels show that the fatty degeneration is more prominent in thigh muscles , equally affecting posterior and anterior compartment , B^with^I relative sparing of the rectus femoris , sartorius and gracilismuscles until late stages ( 4 , 10 and 11 , respectively ) . Strikingly , the fatty tissue is located in the internal parts of almost all the affected muscles in thigh ( 1 , 2 , 3 , 5 - 9 ) , while the external regions are spared . At calf level , only the gastrocnemius medialis muscle ( 12 ) shows this pattern , while the soleus ( 13 ) is diffusely involved . Patient II . 2 ( B^PII^I . 2 ) shows late - stage thigh muscles B^with^I an unusual involvement of the tibialis posteriormuscle ( 14 ) in the lower B^leg^I . 
A Muscle sections show variable labeling using an antibody against glycosylated α - dystroglycan ( αDG - IIH6 ) , whereas labeling using antibodies against α - dystroglycan core protein ( αDG - Core ) , β - dystroglycan ( βDG ) and laminin - 2 is similar to control ( Scale B^bar^I , 100 μm ) . 
B Western blots and ligand - overlay ( O / L ) of wheat - germ agglutinin - enriched muscle and fibroblasts lysates from B^PII^I . 2 , B^PII^I . 5 , the healthy sibling ( HII . 3 ) and healthy controls ( Ctr , Ctr1 , and Ctr2 ) ( Muscle : 250μg protein / lane , Fibroblasts : 800μg / lane ) . In muscle , expression of αDG - IIH6 is reduced B^but^I the αDG - Core shows similar expression as controls , B^with^I a slight reduction in molecular weight ; laminin overlay assay detected some binding activity B^but^I B^was^I diminished compared to controls , whereas agrin - binding activity showed no difference B^with^I controls . In fibroblasts , both αDG - IIH6 and αDG - Core expression and laminin - binding activity were normal , suggesting that unlike other muscular dystrophies , α - dystroglycan glycosylation defect is muscle - specific in B^POGLUT1^I patients . 
C No ultrastructural alterations are observed in muscle by electron microscopy ( 6 - 7 fields were captured from B^PII^I . 1 , B^PII^I . 3 , and B^PII^I . 5 ) . Note normal basement B^membrane^I compactation ( arrowheads ) . Original magnification : 26 , 700 . 
A B^Protein O^I - glucosyltransferase activity of wild - type ( WT ) or D233E mutant B^POGLUT1^I protein toward human factor B^IX^I B^EGF^I repeat ( hFIX - B^EGF^I ) . Wild - type shows higher O - glucosyltransferase activity than D233E , and this activity is dependent on the concentration of the acceptor substrate hFIX - B^EGF^I repeat ( left ) and on the concentration of donor substrate UDP - glucose ( UDP - Glc ) ( right ) . Values indicate mean ± SEM from three independent assays . 
B O - glucosyltransferase activity towards five different single B^EGF^I repeats from mouse B^Notch1^I . Wild - type B^POGLUT1^I shows higher activity toward all B^EGF^I repeats tested than B^POGLUT1^I D233E . The Y - axis shows the normalized activity relative to wild - type B^POGLUT1^I . B^EGF^I repeats were at 10 μM . Values indicate mean ± SEM from three independent assays . 
C Elution profiles of the B^POGLUT1^I reaction products on reverse phase HPLC . hFIX - B^EGF^I repeat B^was^I incubated B^with^I wild - type or D233E mutant B^POGLUT1^I and donor substrate , UDP - Glc or UDP - xylose ( UDP - Xyl ) , at 37ºC overnight . Values on B^top^I of the peaks indicate the measured masses . Addition of Glc ( 162 Da ) or xylose ( 132 Da ) to hFIX - B^EGF^I ( 5696 . 2 Da ) by wild - type B^POGLUT1^I caused a shift to an earlier retention time ( left ) . Similarly , the products exhibited a similar shift after incubation B^with^I B^POGLUT1^I D233E ( right ) . These results indicate that B^POGLUT1^I D233E B^can^I B^add^I a single glucose or xylose to hFIX - B^EGF^I repeats and thus has residual enzymatic activity . 
A Western B^blot^I of muscle homogenates shows reduced expression of B^Notch1^I intracellular domain ( NICD ) in patients . 
B - C qRT - B^PCR^I on RNA extracted from skeletal - muscle shows that expression of B^HES1^I ( B ) and B^PAX7^I ( C ) B^was^I significantly lower in D233E patients compared to healthy controls . Mean ± SEM , Student´s t - test ( B ) and Mann - Whitney U test ( C ) . 
D B^PAX7^I + cells in skeletal muscle sections , demonstrating that satellite cells are less abundant in D233E patients than in controls ( n = 3 muscles B^with^I 10 - 15 fields analyzed B^per^I muscle ) . Mean ± SEM ; Mann - Whitney U test ; Scale B^bar^I , 50 μm . 
A - A " Staining of Drosophila indirect flight muscles at 25 % pupal development B^with^I 22C10 antibody ( myotube marker ) and anti - Twist antibody ( myoblast marker ) indicates that in wild - type animals , indirect flight muscles are formed from 6 myotubes , and a large number of Twist + myoblasts are present . B - B " B^rumi^I 79 / 79 mutants raised at 18C show no obvious defects in myoblast number or myotube morphology . C - D " B^rumi^I 79 / 79 mutants exhibit decreased number of myoblasts at 25° - 30 °C and either an incomplete B^set^I of short myotubes when raised at 25C or aberrant morphology of myotubes when raised at 30C . E - E " B^rumi^I 79 / 79 animals overexpressing FLAG - tagged B^POGLUT1^I WT in the muscle compartment using B^Mef2^I - B^GAL4^I and raised at 25C during the pupal stage show a rescue of the B^rumi^I 79 / 79 muscle phenotype . F - G " Overexpression of FLAG - tagged B^POGLUT1^I D233E only partially rescues the B^rumi^I 79 / 79 muscle phenotype , B^with^I some variation in the myotube length and the number of restored Twist + cells ( compare G and F ) . Note that the number of Twist + cells restored by B^POGLUT1^I D233E is much smaller than that restored by B^POGLUT1^I WT . Scale B^bar^I in A ' is 50 µm and applies to A - G " . H Quantification of myotube lengths in B^rumi^I 79 / 79 mutants B^with^I or without B^POGLUT1^I expression indicates a weak rescue of the phenotypes by B^POGLUT1^I D233E compared to B^POGLUT1^I WT . Mean ± standard deviation is shown . The differences in myotube lengths are statistically significant ( n = 22 - 54 ) . Mean ± standard deviation is shown ; One - way Anova B^with^I Bonferroni´s multiple comparisons test . 
A - F Proliferation assays examined proliferating ( B^PAX7^I + B^MyoD^I + , arrows ) , self - renewing ( B^PAX7^I + B^MyoD^I − , open arrows ) , and differentiating ( B^PAX7^I − B^MyoD^I + , arrowheads ) cells from D233E patients ( n = 2 ) , healthy controls ( n = 3 ) and disease controls ( n = 3 ) at 1 , 4 , and 8 days growing in proliferation medium . ( A ) shows representative images from day 8 . The number of patientmyoblasts is lower than that of controls at all three time points , indicating a slower proliferation rate in patientmyoblasts ( B ) , and accordingly , the percentage of proliferating cells ( C ) is smaller in the patient . ( D ) The percentage of self - renewing cells is small in patient´s culture , reflecting a poor capacity B^for^I maintaining the pool of quiescent SCs . In addition , the percentage of B^PAX7^I + cells ( E ) is smaller in patient´s culture , similarly to what B^was^I found in adult D233E muscle ( shown in Fig 5D ) . ( F ) The percentage of differentiating cells is higher in the patient . We examine proliferation capturing 7 - 12 randomly fields B^per^I day and condition ( mean ± SEM is shown ; Kruskal - Wallis B^with^I Dunn´s multiple comparisons test ; Scale B^bar^I , 50 µm ) . 
G - I When myoblasts started to be confluent , the proliferation medium B^was^I replaced B^with^I differentiation medium , and the myoblasts started to B^fuse^I yielding myotubes , which were analyzed after four days of differentiation . ( H ) The fusion index , which measures the percentage of nuclei in myotubes B^with^I respect to the total number of nuclei in myogenic cells , B^was^I higher in D233E cultures than in controls . ( I ) Besides , myogenin showed increased expression in D233E myoblast cultures compared to controls . The data support that differentiation process is facilitated in patient´s muscle . Data B^was^I collected from 3 - 10 randomly chosen areas B^per^I condition ( mean ± SEM is shown ; Kruskal - Wallis B^with^I Dunn´s multiple comparisons test ( H ) and One - way Anova B^with^I Bonferroni´s multiple comparisons test ( I ) ; Scale B^bar^I , 50 µm ) . 
A - C We overexpressed GFP - tagged NICD in immortalized primary myoblasts to rescue the features displayed by immortalized D233E myoblasts . ( B ) We analyzed the proliferation at 1 , 3 and 5 days , and proliferation rate in patient - LV - NICD - GFP reached the level observed in control - LV - GFP , which were higher than in patient - LV - GFP . ( C ) However , the percentage of B^PAX7^I + cells in patient - LV - NICD - GFP showed the same reduced value as in patient - LV - GFP , which were significantly lower than in control - LV - GFP . The majority of control myoblasts were proliferating cells ( B^PAX7^I + B^MyoD^I + , arrows ) , B^with^I no quiescent cells and few differentiating cells detected . Data were collected from n = 2 independent assays ( 5 - 8 images B^per^I condition ) . Mean ± SEM is shown ; One - way Anova B^with^I Tukey multiple comparisions test ( B ) and Kruskal - Wallis B^with^I Dunn´s multiple comparisons test ( C ) ; Scale B^bar^I , 50 µm ) . 
D - F As previously described in patient ' s primary myoblasts , patient - LV - GFP myoblasts showed a striking facilitated differentiation compared to control - LV - GFP - myoblasts . This phenotype fully disappeared in patient - LV - GFP - NICD myoblasts , as quantification of the fusion index ( E ) , and myogenin expression ( F ) demonstrated . The data support a pathogenic role B^for^I B^Notch^I inhibition on the altered differentiation in our patients . Data were collected from n = 3 independent assays ( 13 - 17 images B^per^I condition ) . Mean ± SEM is shown ; Kruskal - Wallis B^with^I Dunn´s multiple comparisons test ; Scale B^bar^I , 50 µm ) . 
A Immortalized primary myoblasts from a healthy control showed a progressive pattern of α - dystroglycan glycosylation during five days of differentiation ( D0 - D5 ) , as has been previously described by Goddeeris et al . Immortalized primary myoblasts from patients displayed an irregular pattern of glycosylation , B^with^I a final level of glycosylated α - dystroglycan that B^was^I lower than control . 
B α - dystroglycan glycosylation of infected immortalized myoblasts from patient - LV - NICD - GFP at differentiation day 5 ( D5 ) showed a striking reduction , in line B^with^I the strong inhibition of myotubes formation and differentiation induced by NICD overexpression . α - dystroglycan in myoblasts from patient - LV - GFP showed a reduction of glycosylation compared to control - LV - GFP at D5 , similar to the results obtained in the adult muscle from patients ( Fig . 2 ) . 
C - D C2C12 myogenic cells showed a reduced level of glycosylated α - dystroglycan when the B^Notch^I signaling inhibitor DAPT or LY3039478 B^was^I added to the differentiation medium . This indicates that reducing B^Notch^I signaling B^can^I affect α - dystroglycan glycosylation in wild - type C2C12 myoblasts cells , which do B^not^I harbor any known mutations in α - dystroglycan glycosyltransferases or B^Poglut1^I . 
E - F qRT - B^PCR^I experiments show that upon DAPT or LY3039478 treatment , a remarkable decrease in B^Hes1^I mRNA is induced in C2C12 cells during differentiation .

Electropherograms show a heterozygous c . 3610C > T substitution resulting in a B^stop^I codon ( R1204X ) . Arrows in family pedigrees indicate the patients identified in the present study . In audiograms : B^red^I and B^blue^I indicate right and left ; respectively , solid and dashed lines and B^square^I brackets show B^air^I conduction hearing and bone conduction hearing ; respectively . The bold line ( at the age of 48 years ) and thin line ( at the age of 50 years ) in the audiogram of patient 1 indicate progressive hearing loss ( green arrow ) .

GFP - tagged B^DIA1^I ( WT ) , B^DIA1^I ( R1204X ) , and B^DIA1^I ( M1190D ) were transfected into XTC cells . XTC cells were spread on the PLL - coated coverslips and time - lapse images were acquired every 300 ms , illuminating the restricted areas near the cell edges , by using a single - molecule speckle microscope . Representative images are shown B^for^I B^DIA1^I ( WT ) ( A , Movie EV5 ) , B^DIA1^I ( R1204X ) ( B , Movie EV6 ) , and B^DIA1^I ( M1190D ) ( C , Movie EV7 ) . Circles indicate speckles showing directional movement over a distance of several micrometers . Trajectories of these speckles are also illustrated , and crosses were plotted at the B^end^I of the directional movement . Speckles showing directional movement were frequently observed in cells expressing GFP - B^DIA1^I ( R1204X ) ( B ) , whereas such speckles were scarce in cells expressing GFP - B^DIA1^I ( WT ) ( A ) . However , the density of these speckles in GFP - B^DIA1^I ( R1204X ) - expressing cells appeared lower than that in GFP - B^DIA1^I ( M1190D ) - expressing cells , which is considered a fully active mutant ( C ) . To evaluate the frequency of speckles indicating directional movement , we performed a quantitative analysis ( D ) . The number of speckles showing directional movement during 3 continuous planes B^was^I counted and were normalized by the fluorescent intensity of each cell , which corresponds to the expression level of the GFP - tagged protein . * P = 0 . 0288 and * * P = 0 . 0002 Bonferroni ' s B^post^I B^hoc^I test following one - way ANOVA ( WT ; n = 5 , R1204X ; n = 6 , M1190D ; n = 6 ) . B^Time^I is in seconds . Scale bars : 5 µm .

 ( C ) Representative confocal laser - scanning microscopy pictures of biofilm development of bacteria cultured B^for^I 4 d in minimal medium in chambered cover slides under B^light^I or dark conditions . The scale B^bar^I represents 30 µm . 
 ( B ) The inherent elastic response of a lipid B^membrane^I ( POPC ) B^was^I studied by enforcing indentations via the isolated SNARE C - termini in the presence or absence of a short linker peptide , or the linker plus a fluorescent protein B^tag^I ( B^FP^I ) . We define " relative indentation " as the change in C - terminus ( Nyv1 ) - C - terminus ( Vam3 ) distance that occurs when the SNARE complex performs mechanical work . It reflects the depth of the formed well upon squeezing . The slope of the obtained work profile estimates the required force ( thin black line ) . Perforation ( B^red^I arrow ) requires a force of 80 pN B^for^I the wild - type C - termini . The plateau within the work profile indicates that the B^membrane^I gives up its elastic response ( perforation transition ) . C - terminal tags oppose such a perforation transition B^but^I do B^not^I significantly affect the forces observed within the indentation regime . Furthermore , if the unstructured peptide - spacer would be B^alpha^I - helical - and thus much shorter - indentation forces would still be only slightly affected . 
 ( B ) Vacuoles were isolated from the indicated yeast strains and 30 µg of proteins analyzed by B^SDS^I - PAGE and Western blotting .

C . Semithin section and g - ratio analyses of sciatic nerves at B^P30^I shows that Niaspan does B^not^I alter myelin thickness in WT nerves , whereas restores myelin thickness to normal values in B^Vim^I - / - nerves . G - ratio values : WT saline , 0 . 71 ± 0 . 003 , 1872 fibers , n = 5 animals ; WT Niaspan , 0 . 71 ± 0 . 004 , 1882 fibers , n = 5 animals ; B^Vim^I - / - saline 0 . 69 ± 0 . 004 , 2313 fibers , n = 6 animals ; B^Vim^I - / - Niaspan 0 . 72 ± 0 . 01 , 1616 fibers , n = 5 animals . WT saline as compared to B^Vim^I - / - saline , p = 0 . 0588 ; B^Vim^I - / - saline as compared to B^Vim^I - / - Niaspan , p = 0 . 0431 , repeated measures ANOVA , representative of two independent experiments . The number of myelinated fibers is similar between the 4 groups as shown , p = 0 . 3042 , nonparametric one - way ANOVA , followed by Dunn ' s B^post^I B^hoc^I test . 
A . Niaspan administration ( daily i . p . injection of 160mg / Kg starting at B^P15^I B^for^I 60 days ) does B^not^I affect the growth of B^Mtmr2^I - / - mice . The growth rates of B^Mtmr2^I - / - and WT both saline - treated are significantly different , p < 0 . 0001 , Linear Mixed Effect ( LME ) models , as already reported ( Bolino et al , 2004 ) , n = 8 animals B^per^I condition . 
B . Niaspan administration reduces the percentage of myelin outfoldings ( B^red^I asterisks ) in B^Mtmr2^I - / - sciatic nerves without affecting the number of myelinated fibers as assessed by semithin section analysis at B^P75^I , n = 8 mice B^per^I genotype , results are mean ± SEM , p = 0 . 0093 , two - tailed Mann Whitney U test , representative of three independent experiments . Niaspan treatment does B^not^I alter myelin thickness in WT or B^Mtmr2^I - / - mice as assessed by g - ratio analysis ( WT saline - treated , 0 . 67 ± 0 . 003 , 2014 fibers ; B^Mtmr2^I - / - Niaspan - treated , 0 . 67 ± 0 . 007 , 1924 fibers ; B^Mtmr2^I - / - saline - treated , 0 . 68 ± 0 . 003 , 2244 fibers ; n = 4 animals B^per^I condition ) . 
A . B . Western B^blot^I analysis of B^Tace^I using lysates from B^Pmp22^I + / - and WT sciatic nerves at different stages of development . The arrowhead indicates the B^pro^I - protein and the arrow shows the cleaved active form of B^Tace^I . Representative of two independent experiments . 
B . B^Tace^I activity as measured in B^Pmp22^I + / - and WT sciatic nerves at B^P30^I ( n = 6 mice B^per^I genotype , results are mean ± SEM , p = 0 . 0070 , two - tailed Mann Whitney U test ) . 
C . Representative images of semithin section analysis of sciatic nerves at B^P45^I from B^Pmp22^I + / - saline and B^Pmp22^I + / - Niaspan - treated mice . Niaspan B^was^I administered daily by i . p . injection at 160mg / Kg starting at B^P15^I B^for^I 30 days . C ' . The percentage of tomacula in sciatic nerves B^was^I assessed by ultrastructural analysis , results are mean ± SEM , n = 6 animals B^per^I condition , p = 0 . 0022 , two - tailed Mann Whitney U test , representative of two independent experiments . D . G - ratio analysis on semithin sections of sciatic nerves shows that increased myelin thickness in B^Pmp22^I + / - sciatic nerves at B^P45^I is restored to normal values following Niaspan treatment . Mean g - ratio values , WT saline - treated : 0 . 69 ± 0 . 002 , 2052 fibers , n = 5 animals ; B^Pmp22^I + / - saline - treated : 0 . 66 ± 0 . 003 , 2643 fibers , n = 6 animals ; B^Pmp22^I + / - Niaspan - treated , 0 . 68 ± 0 . 002 , 2311 fibers , n = 6 animals . WT saline as compared to B^Pmp22^I + / - saline - treated , p < 0 . 0001 ; B^Pmp22^I + / - saline - treated as compared to B^Pmp22^I + / - Niaspan - treated , p = 0 . 0002 ; B^Pmp22^I + / - Niaspan - treated as compared to WT saline , p = 0 . 0899 ; repeated measures ANOVA . E . The number of myelinated fibers is similar between the 3 groups analyzed , p = 0 . 4362 , nonparametric one - way ANOVA , followed by Dunn ' s B^post^I B^hoc^I test . 
A . Western B^blot^I analysis to detect phosphorylation levels of B^Akt^I ( S473 ) on lysates from B^Pmp22^I - / - and WT mice at B^P20^I , B^with^I quantification . Results are mean ± SEM , p = 0 . 6857 , two - tailed Mann Whitney U test , representative of three independent experiments . 
B . Western B^blot^I analysis B^for^I B^Mbp^I and P0 on lysates from B^Pmp22^I - / - and WT mice B^P20^I shows decreased myelin protein expression levels at both time points in B^Pmp22^I - / - nerves , results are mean ± SEM , p = 0 . 0500 B^with^I the exception of the P0 protein level at B^P20^I , B^for^I which the difference between B^Pmp22^I - / - and WT nerves is B^not^I statistically significant , p = 0 . 1000 , one - tailed Mann Whitney U test , representative of two independent experiments . 
C . Representative images of semithin section analysis of WT and B^Pmp22^I - / - sciatic nerves at B^P30^I . Tomacula are abundant in B^Pmp22^I - / - nerves at this age , where both fibers B^with^I thicker myelin ( in the range of < 3 - 4 μm in diameter ) and thinner myelin ( B^with^I diameters greater than 4 μm , particularly in motor fasicles ) B^can^I be observed . C ' . Niaspan does B^not^I ameliorate the phenotype in B^Pmp22^I - / - mice , as indicated by the number of tomacula ( quantification of the percentage of tomacula in the entire sciatic nerve section , results are mean ± SEM , p = 0 . 7400 , Mann Whitney U test , n = 15 animals B^per^I condition ) . 
D . Growth curve of B^Pmp22^I - / - mice treated B^with^I Niaspan administered by i . p . injection daily at 160mg / Kg and starting at B^P15^I B^for^I 15 days . A significant time by group effect is noted between WT saline and B^Pmp22^I - / - saline ( group effect p = 0 . 9907 and time effect p = 0 . 0057 ) , indicating that the two groups start B^with^I similar weight values B^but^I then the WT saline group ( n = 6 animals ) grows more in time . When B^Pmp22^I - / - saline ( n = 5 ) and B^Pmp22^I - / - Niaspan - treated ( n = 6 ) are compared , the group effect is statistically significant ( p = 0 . 0076 ) while the time effect is B^not^I ( p = 0 . 6677 ) , suggesting that these two groups have a similar growth trend B^but^I B^Pmp22^I - / - Niaspan - treated group starts B^with^I a higher baseline weight . 
E . Niaspan does B^not^I ameliorate myelin thickness as indicated by g - ratio analysis , B^with^I axonal diameter distribution : WT 0 . 68 ± 0 . 003 , 2945 fibers , n = 5 animals ; B^Pmp22^I - / - 0 . 64 ± 0 . 003 , 1557 fibers , n = 6 animals ; B^Pmp22^I - / - Niaspan 0 . 63 ± 0 . 003 , 1445 fibers , n = 6 animals , results are mean ± SEM . WT saline as compared to B^Pmp22^I - / - saline - treated p < 0 . 0001 ; WT saline as compared to B^Pmp22^I - / - Niaspan - treated p < 0 . 0001 , repeated measures ANOVA . Note the loss of myelinated fibers in B^Pmp22^I - / - nerves B^for^I all caliber axons .

A . B^SHOX^I protein representation and luciferase assay . The variants found in B^SHOX^I are indicated in B^red^I . B^Luciferase^I assays to test the B^impact^I of B^SHOX^I mutations on its transcriptional activity were performed on B^FGFR3^I promoter in U2OS cells ( n = 4 ) . Experiments were performed in triplicates . pcDNA4 - B^TO^I empty vector B^was^I used as control . R153L represents a mutation known to affect B^SHOX^I protein activity and B^was^I used as positive control ( Schneider et al . , 2005 ) . Homeodomain , DNA binding domain ; B^Src^I Homology 3 domain ; OAR , OtpAristalessRax domain . RLU , Relative Light Units . 
B . B^CYP26C1^I protein representation and luciferase assay . Variants found in B^CYP26C1^I are indicated in green . Cignal - RARE system luciferase assays to test the B^impact^I of B^CYP26C1^I variants on its B^RA^I degradation activity were performed in U2OS cells treated B^with^I 250 nM all - trans retinoic acid ( ATRA ) B^for^I 24 hours ( n = 4 ) . Experiments were performed in triplicates . pIRES2 - EGFP empty vector B^was^I used as control . The residue C459 represents the Iron binding residue ( Q6VOL0 , UniProtKB ) and B^was^I mutated to Ala and used as a positive control . In each image a clone is circled in B^white^I , illustrating the progression of clone size at different times . b ) Histogram charts showing the relative frequency of clones according to their size between 3 and 24 weeks in mice induced at B^P21^I and B^P42^I . The frequency of larger clones increases over time . B^Chi^I B^square^I test p < 0 . 0001 B^for^I B^P21^I group and p = 0 . 0056 B^for^I B^P42^I group . The number of clones evaluated at each time point is indicated above each histogram series . c ) and d ) Correction B^for^I contiguous clones harbouring a same colour . 
d ) Plots show the probability B^for^I an individual keratinocyte to belong to a clone of a given size . Experimental data are represented in green bars . Red curve represents the 5 - colour simulation and the B^blue^I curve the real size simulation . Although the frequency of large clones is overestimated in experimental data due to the limited 5 - color palette , it is apparent that real clone size progresses over time . 
e ) Histogram charts showing the distribution of clones at D1 - 3 following tamoxifen induction according to total number of cells and number of basal cells .

a ) Clones were categorized as attached or B^not^I attached to hair follicles . Average clone size of attached ( circles ) and non - attached ( squares ) clones were plotted over time . T - test , * * * p < 0 . 0001 , * * p < 0 . 001 . ( Number of clones : 1 week n = 271 , 3 weeks n = 1847 , 5 weeks n = 517 , 12 weeks n = 706 , 24 weeks n = 258 ) . b ) Photomicrographs represent 2D optical sections from a Z stack acquisition of a whole mounted back skin harbouring multiple clones of different colours at 12 weeks . The yellow and B^blue^I clone in the IFE immediately adjacent to a B^HF^I are considered as attached to the B^HF^I . The orange and pink clones are B^not^I attached to the B^HF^I . Limits of clones ( lines ) and cells ( dots ) within each clone were identified on this optical section . B^White^I dashed circles represent the projection of hair follicle openings ( scale B^bar^I = 50 µm ) . 
c ) Bar charts showing the relative frequency of clone size between 3 and 24 weeks after recombination . In the B^P42^I group , clones attached to B^HF^I were more likely to be bigger than those B^not^I attached at 3 , 5 , 12 and 24 weeks . ǂǂǂǂ B^Chi^I B^square^I test p < 0 . 0001 . Of note , whether attached or B^not^I clones continued to grow over time : * * * * B^Chi^I B^square^I test p < 0 . 0001 . All data are represented as mean ± s . e . m . 
d ) Plot showing the probability of a clone to be attached to a hair follicle as a function of its size ( dashed line : predicted curve based on theoretical probabilities according to spacing of hair follicles at different time - points ; squares : experimental data ) . Between different time points the distance between hair follicles varies slightly ; therefore each time point ( 3 , 5 , 12 and 24 weeks ) has a distinct theoretical curve . The observed frequency of clone attachment to hair follicles is at every time point above the random prediction . 
a ) Anagen and telogen skin identified by skin pigmentation at the time of collection were obtained from each Skinbowmouse at different time points . Histogram charts represent the relative frequency of clone size from clones attached ( B^top^I B^row^I ) or B^not^I ( bottom B^row^I ) to B^HF^I in anagen and telogen phase at the time of tissue collection . Clones connected to hair follicles were more likely to be larger in anagen compared to telogen ( B^Chi^I B^square^I test , * * * p = 0 . 0009 at 3 weeks , * * * p < 0 . 0001 at 5 weeks , * p = 0 . 0193 at 12 weeks , * * * p = 0 . 0001 at 24 weeks ) . However no difference between the two phases B^was^I observed in clones that were B^not^I attached to HFs . Clone numbers are indicated on the graph . All data are represented as mean ± s . e . m . 
b ) Telogen skin B^was^I obtained from Skinbowmice induced at B^P42^I at different time points from 1 to 24 weeks B^post^I - induction . Each skin sample B^was^I evaluated B^for^I the average number of club hair found in hair follicles reflecting its history of past hair cycling . Average clone size of attached ( circles ) and non - attached ( squares ) clones were plotted over the number of club hair . T - test , * * * * p < 0 . 0001 . 
c ) Skinbow mice were induced at a time were the back skin contained both areas of anagen and telogen and samples collected B^for^I evaluation at 7 days . Histogram charts represent the relative frequency of clone size from clones attached ( B^top^I B^row^I ) or B^not^I ( bottom B^row^I ) to B^HF^I in anagen and telogen phase at induction . Even at a rate of one cell division B^per^I 24h , 7 cycles of divisions results in 128 cells . Therefore the findings reported are B^not^I incompatible B^with^I our claims as suggested . Observation of spontaneous recombinations if they exist are therefore a very rare event that we have never been able to observe . Such rare event is unlikely to influence our analysis based on sizes of hundreds of clones . B^Chi^I B^square^I test , * * * p = 0 . 001 ; * * p = 0 . 01 . 
 ( a - b ) Ki67 immunohistochemistry of back skin sections at different phases of the hair follicle cycle determined using a bioluminescent reporter mice of the canonical B^Wnt^I signaling pathway ( a ) and corresponding scatter plots quantification . ( Scale B^bar^I 100µm ) ( b ) . Analysis focused on the basal layer of the IFE . Each B^dot^I represents one image . Proliferation in the IFE is significantly increased during the anagen phase except in B^mid^I - anagen . Unpaired t test , * * * * p < 0 . 0001 , * * p = 0 . 0020 . B^EA^I n = 32 , B^EMA^I n = 13 , B^MA^I n = 15 , C n = 21 , T n = 19 from 6 mice . Black arrows : positive Ki67 cells . 
 ( c ) Photomicrographs represent 2D optical sections from Z stack acquisition of whole mounted back skin stained in anagen and telogen B^with^I anti - Ki67 antibody or upon BrdU incorporation . Ki67 + cells are labelled B^with^I Alexa 647 ( B^red^I ) . The density of Ki67 + cells increased in the anagen phase ( iii and iv ) compared to telogen ( i and ii ) . B^White^I arrows : B^ki67^I + cells . ( Scale B^bar^I = 20µm ) . Similarly , short B^term^I BrdU pulse ( 2h ) resulted in significant staining of anagen epidermal areas ( vi , B^red^I nuclear stain ) reinforcing hair follicle openings as compared to telogen areas . 
a - b ) Skinbow mice were induced B^for^I 5 consecutive days and pulsed B^with^I BrdU B^for^I 3 consecutive days B^with^I 2 injections B^per^I day . Skin B^was^I collected either immediately after the last BrdU injection at 72hours or after periods of 1 to 5 weeks of chase . a ) Photomicrographs show optical sections from a confocal image stack acquired on a whole mounted skin preparation immunostained B^with^I anti - BrdU antibody ( B^red^I ) . B^White^I dots represent hair follicles at different chase time points . 
a - b ) Skinbowmice were induced B^for^I 5 consecutive days and pulsed B^with^I BrdU B^for^I 3 consecutive days B^with^I 2 injections B^per^I day . Skin B^was^I collected either immediately after the last BrdU injection at 72hours or after periods of 1 to 5 weeks of chase . b ) At 5 weeks of chase , BrdU staining ( green ) in skinbowskin revealed single cells distant from hair follicles . B^White^I dashed circles : hair follicles . B^White^I line : small clones . B^White^I arrows : BrdU + cells . ( scale B^bar^I = 20 µm ) . 
c - d ) In Skinbowmice induced at B^P42^I - 46 , TPA B^was^I applied B^for^I one day , 3 weeks B^post^I - induction and animals were sacrificed at 48hours following a short pulse of BrdU ( 2h ) . c ) Photomicrographs show optical sections from a confocal image stack acquired on a 0 . 5 mm back skin section immunostained B^with^I anti - B^ki67^I antibody . Ki67 + cells are labelled B^with^I Alexa 647 ( B^red^I ) . Back skin from treated and untreated areas B^was^I collected 48hrs after TPA topical application . 
c - d ) In Skinbow mice induced at B^P42^I - 46 , TPA B^was^I applied B^for^I one day , 3 weeks B^post^I - induction and animals were sacrificed at 48hours following a short pulse of BrdU ( 2h ) . d ) Multiple optical section from a Z stack acquisition of whole mount preparation of skin treated B^with^I TPA and stained B^with^I anti - BrdU ( green ) . Small clones B^not^I attached to B^HF^I ( 2 examples figured by dashed lines ) B^can^I be tracked from the corneocyte layer down to the basement B^membrane^I where BrdU staining demonstrates their proliferation . 
e ) ( i to iv ) Representative individual sections from Z stacks , show small clones ( lines ) identified in back skin treated ( i and ii ) or B^not^I B^with^I TPA ( iii and iv ) . ( scale B^bar^I = 100 µm ) . ( v to viii ) Maximal intensity projection from stack acquired on whole mounted skin . A contribution of the infundibulum and the bulge to the IFE is observed in back skin treated B^with^I TPA ( v to vi ) compared to skin treated B^with^I vehicle ( vii and viii ) . ( scale bars = 100 µm ) . f ) Reduction in small clone frequency in the areas treated B^with^I TPA . Histogram chart showing the clone size distribution and relative frequency of small clones B^not^I attached to B^HF^I in areas treated B^with^I TPA and B^not^I treated B^with^I TPA in a same mouse . Mann Whitney test , * * p = 0 . 0079 . Data pooled from 3 mice represented as median B^with^I interquartile range . The number of clones analyzed is indicated on the graph . * p = 0 . 0272 . Data are represented as mean ± s . e . m .

B , C . MTT cytotoxicity assay . ( B ) HT22 cell line B^was^I treated B^with^I various concentrations of Nec - 1 ( 0 - 200 μM ) . Aggregated Aβ ( 1 - 42 ) B^was^I used as the positive control B^for^I the induction of neural cell death . All data represented the mean ± standard deviation of three independent experiments performed in triplicate . 
B , C . MTT cytotoxicity assay . ( C ) HT22 , B^BV2^I cell lines and primary astrocytes were B^pre^I - treated B^with^I Nec - 1 ( 50 μM ) 15 minutes prior to application of 10 μM of B^pre^I - aggregated Aβ ( 1 - 42 ) B^for^I indicated times . Cell proliferation B^was^I then measured by MTT assay . All data represented the mean ± standard deviation of three independent experiments performed in triplicate . 
D , E . Neural cell death levels measured by staining B^with^I the Live / Dead Viability / Cytotoxicity Assay B^Kit^I ( Molecular Probes ) . Pre - treatment of cells B^with^I 50 μM Nec - 1 preceded the application of 10 μM B^pre^I - aggregated Aβ ( 1 - 42 ) by 15 minutes . The assay B^was^I performed 24 hours after Aβ ( 1 - 42 ) application . ( D ) Representation of the stained cells . Scale B^bar^I = 500 μm ( E ) Quantification of dead cells stained by B^EthD^I - 1 .
