The refined models of four crystal structures of the ribosome bound to aminoacyl - or peptidyl - B^tRNA^I analogs are displayed in their respective unbiased electron density Fo - Fc maps ( contoured at 2 . 5σ ) . The maps were calculated using phases produced by rigid body refinement of the ligand - free test structure B^put^I into the Fo data B^set^I . A , B . A - site bound substrates B^ACC^I - Puromycin ( A ) and ACCA - Pro ( B ) . 
The refined models of four crystal structures of the ribosome bound to aminoacyl - or peptidyl - B^tRNA^I analogs are displayed in their respective unbiased electron density Fo - Fc maps ( contoured at 2 . 5σ ) . The maps were calculated using phases produced by rigid body refinement of the ligand - free test structure B^put^I into the Fo data B^set^I . C , D . P - site bound substrates ACCA - Leu - Phe ( C ) and ACCA - Pro - Pro ( D ) . 
This figure compares conformation of aminoacyl residues of the two A - site substrates : A . B^ACC^I - Puromycin B . ACCA - Pro . To show position of the A - site substrates relative to the P - site , the model P - site substrate B^tRNA^I - Phe is shown as in the B^pre^I - attack complex of the ribosome ( pdb id 1vy4 ) . In both illustrations , the A site is viewed as through the peptide exit tunnel . In addition to S . cerevisiae residues numbering , E . coli numbering is shown in parenthesis . Comparison of the two structures shows that the B^side^I chain of the methyl - tyrosine is bound to the conserved hydrophobic A - site cleft , whereas the B^side^I chain of the proline residue penetrates the actual site of peptide B^bond^I formation where it may interfere B^with^I alignment of the reacting groups and proper positioning of the attacking electron pair of the α - amine . 
This figure compares conformation of two dipeptides in the ribosome nascent peptide tunnel : A . Phe - Leu peptide B . Pro - Pro peptide . 
The syntheses of the ligands B^PR^I - 924 , 9 , 14 , 16 , 17 and 18 have been described previously ( de Bruin et al , 2014 ) . All ligands share the peptide scaffold shown in the upper left corner B^with^I B^P1^I , B^P2^I and B^P3^I B^side^I chains and an N - B^cap^I ; they are equipped B^with^I a l - Ala ( stereochemistry ( S ) ) or d - Ala ( stereochemistry ( R ) ) residue at B^P3^I ( B^red^I ) and either an N - acylmorpholine or a 3 - methyl - 1H - indene group ( green ) . Furthermore , compounds differ in their B^P2^I residue ( either methoxytyrosine or tryptophane ; B^blue^I ) . Inhibitor 9 , also termed LU - 015i , is endowed B^with^I an exceptional cyclohexyl residue ( gray ) , which is associated B^with^I increased selectivity B^for^I human β5i . 
A . Inhibition of human β5c and β5i by ONX 0914 and B^PR^I - 924 . IC50 values are deduced from the fitted data . 
E . Serial dilutions of yeast cells were spotted on YPD plates and grown B^for^I 2 days either at 30 °C or 37 °C . Mutant yeasts are significantly retarded in growth and show increased temperature sensitivity . 
F . Surface illustration of the yCP . The β5 and β6 subunits are depicted in dark gray , B^with^I the residue ranges that correspond to mammalian β5 and β6 subunits in the chimeric proteasomes highlighted in gold and B^blue^I , respectively . The β5 ' and β6 ' subunits of the second β - ring are hidden on the back of B^20S^I proteasome . 
A . Superposition of the β5i / β6 active sites of genuine mouse iCP and the hβ5i / hβ6 human / yeast chimera illustrates that Met45 adopts the same ' open ' conformation in both structures . Amino acid B^side^I chains important B^for^I substrate binding are depicted as sticks . The catalytic Thr1 is colored in black . Met31 , the single amino acid difference between mouse and human β5i active sites , is highlighted in green . 
B . Superposition of the genuine mouse and the human chimeric β5c / β6 active sites according to panel A proves the proper orientation of Met45 in the ' closed ' conformation . 
C . Superposition of the β5c / β6 and β5i / β6 active sites of the natural mouse cCP and iCP according to panel A . Note the distinct conformations of Met45 ( Huber et al , 2012 ) . 
D . Superposition of the hβ5c / hβ6 and the hβ5i / hβ6 chimeric proteasomes confirm the distinct positions of Met45 analogously to the natural mouse subunits shown in panel C . 
A . Complex structures of the human β5c / β6 ( left ) and β5i / β6 ( right ) chimeric proteasomes B^with^I B^PR^I - 924 . The ligand binds in a linear ( l ) manner to the β5c / β6 substrate binding channel , B^but^I in a kinked ( k ) conformation to the β5i / β6 active site . The 2FO - B^FC^I electron density maps B^for^I the ligands bound to Thr1 of the chimeric β5 active sites are shown as B^blue^I meshes contoured at 1σ . The inhibitor and Thr1 have been omitted B^for^I phasing . 
B . Comparison of the conformations of ONX 0914 , B^PR^I - 924 , 14 , 16 , 17 and 18 bound to the chimeric hβ5 / hβ6 substrate binding channels . The l amino acid compounds ONX 0914 and 14 display a linear ( l ) binding mode to the hβ5c / hβ6 ( left ) and the hβ5i / hβ6 ( right ) chimeras , whereas the ligands 16 and 17 ( B^P3^I - d - Ala and morpholine B^cap^I ) adopt a kinked ( k ) conformation in both β5 substrate binding channels . Remarkably , the orientation of B^PR^I - 924 and its analogue 18 ( B^P3^I - d - Ala and 3 - methyl - 1H - indene B^cap^I ) in the hβ5c / hβ6 chimera ( and in WT yβ5 ; see Appendix Figure S5 ) ) differs from that observed B^with^I the hβ5i / hβ6 chimera . Note that the inhibitors are rotated by about 45 ° compared to panel A . 
A . Complex structures of the mouse chimeric proteasome ( left ) and the hβ5i - V31M / hβ6 mutant ( right ) B^with^I B^PR^I - 924 visualize the kinked ( k ) orientation . The 2FO - B^FC^I electron density maps B^for^I the ligands bound to Thr1 of the chimeric β5 active sites are depicted according to Fig 5A . Steric hindrance of Met31 ( green ) B^with^I the bulky 3 - methyl - 1H - indene B^cap^I is indicated by black B^double^I arrows . 
B . Superposition of inhibitors bound to the mouse chimeric proteasome ( left ) and the hβ5i - V31M / hβ6 mutant ( right ) . Compounds display the same binding modes ( kinked ( k ) or linear ( l ) ) to the mβ5i / mβ6 active site as to the corresponding human β5i / β6 subunit ( Fig . 5 ) and to the hβ5i - V31M / hβ6 mutant . Note that the inhibitors are rotated by about 45° compared to panel A . 
C . Superposition of chimeric mammalian and WT yeast β5 active sites bound to the B^P3^I - d - Ala compounds B^PR^I - 924 and 18 . The nucleophilic Thr1 is depicted as well as the S1 pocket forming residues 31 and 45 . Residue 31 impacts on the position of the 3 - methyl - 1H - indene B^cap^I of B^PR^I - 924 and 18 . Due to steric hindrance , the N - B^cap^I is shifted in the mouse and in the hβ5i - V31M / hβ6 chimera compared to the hβ5i / hβ6 mutant proteasome crystal structures ( black B^double^I arrow ) . Note that the structures are rotated by 90° compared to panel B . 
ONX 0914 binds in a linear mode to all active sites . Changing the stereochemistry at the B^P3^I site from l - Ala ( S ) to d - Ala ( R ) leads to a kinked conformation in the β5 substrate binding channels ( compound 16 ) . Substitution of the morpholine B^cap^I of 16 by a larger 3 - metyhl - 1H - indene moiety yields B^PR^I - 924 and results in different inhibitor conformations at the yβ5 / hβ5c and the mammalian β5i active sites . Hereby , the selectivity B^for^I hβ5i over hβ5c is drastically increased ( IC50 ratio hβ5c / hβ5i : 255 ) compared to ONX 0914 ( IC50 ratio hβ5c / hβ5i : 20 ) and compound 16 ( IC50 ratio hβ5c / hβ5i : 5 . 2 , Fig 2 ) . Residue Met31 of mβ5i sterically hinders the kinked binding mode of B^PR^I - 924 , thereby creating 7 - fold selectivity B^for^I human β5i .

 ( A - B " ) Colocalization of B^osk^I B^MS2^I - mCherry ( B^red^I , A , B ) ( A ' , B ' ) B^with^I B^Khc^I - EGFP ( green , A ) ( A ' ) or B^with^I EmGFP - B^Tm1^I - I ( green B ) ( B ' ) in ex vivo ooplasmic preparations . ( C ) Fraction of B^osk^I B^MS2^I - B^MCP^I - mCherry mRNPs located non - randomly within a 200 nm distance of one of the indicated GFP tagged protein particles in ex vivo ooplasmic preparations . B^MCP^I indicates B^MCP^I - EGFP which , like B^MCP^I - mCherry , B^can^I bind to B^MS2^I loops . Staufen ( Stau ) is a dsRNA binding protein and bona fide partner of B^oskar^I mRNA ( St Johnston et al . , 1991 ; St Johnston et al . , 1992 ) . All values are significantly different from zero ( p < 10 - 3 , one sample t - test ) . Numbers indicate the number of particle clusters ( 160 mRNPs in each ) and the number of preparations ( in brackets ) analysed . Error bars represent 95 % confidence intervals .

Note that mCherry - B^Tm1^I - I B^was^I exposed twice as long as B^Khc^I - mKate to obtain comparable B^red^I fluorescence signals . Scale bars represent 1 µm and 1 second , respectively . The B^Khc^I association frequency observed on RNPs before ( checked ) and during ( B^dotted^I ) their motility is B^not^I significantly different from wild - type motile B^RNP^I controls ( p > 0 . 01 ) .

 ( a ) B^Caspase^I 3 IHC of tumours from B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I and B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I B^Huwe1^I mice either untreated or 6h B^post^I treatment B^with^I 7 . 5mg / kg cisplatin . Arrows identify caspase 3 positive cells . Scale bars = 50 µm . ( b ) Quantification of cisplatin treatment showing a significant increase in apoptosis in B^Huwe1^I deficient tumour cells ( Mann - Whitney , n = 3 vs 5 ) . 
 ( c ) Comparison of somatic mutation rate ( mutations / Mb ) between human tumours carrying B^HUWE1^I mutations or B^not^I . Note the significant increase in mutational burden in B^HUWE1^I mutated tumours ( Mann - Whitney , p = 0 . 0002 , n ≥ 15 ) . 
 ( d ) Comparison of somatic mutation rate ( mutations / Mb ) between human tumours carrying B^HUWE1^I mutations or B^not^I grouped according to B^MLH1^I status . Note that the increased mutation rate is found primarily in tumours where B^MLH1^I is B^not^I silenced indicating increased mutation rate ( and B^HUWE1^I mutation itself ) is B^not^I due to silencing of B^MLH1^I ( Mann - Whitney , p = 0 . 0007 , n ≥ 11 ) . 
 ( e ) Survival analysis of colorectal cancer patients treated B^with^I adjuvant chemotherapy divided by B^HUWE1^I expression levels . Note the lowest B^HUWE1^I expressing quartile of patients respond significantly better to chemotherapy . ( f ) Survival analysis of colorectal cancer patients B^not^I treated B^with^I adjuvant chemotherapy divided by B^HUWE1^I expression levels . Note the lowest B^HUWE1^I expressing quartile of patients do B^not^I survive significantly longer than those expressing higher levels of B^HUWE1^I if B^not^I treated B^with^I chemotherapy . 
 ( b ) Kaplan - Meier survival plot of cohorts of induced B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I and B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I B^Huwe1^I mice . Deletion of B^Huwe1^I led to a significant reduction in survival of these animals ( Log Rank , p < 0 . 001 , n ≥ 15 ) . 
 ( c ) B^Lysozyme^I IHC demonstrating increased B^lysozyme^I positive cell numbers in tumours from B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I B^Huwe1^I mice .  ( a ) B^MCL1^I Western B^blot^I in protein extracts from Vil B^Apc^I and Vil B^Apc^I B^Huwe1^I B^hom^I tumours . Levels of B^MCL1^I protein are significantly increased in tumours lacking B^HUWE1^I ( Mann Whitney , p = 0 . 04 , n = 3 ) . 
 ( b ) Kaplan - Meier survival plot of cohorts of induced B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I B^Huwe1^I and B^Lgr5^I B^Apc^I B^Huwe1^I B^Mcl1^I mice . Deletion of one copy of B^Mcl1^I led to a significant increase in survival of these animals ( Log Rank , p = 0 . 0052 , n = 9 vs 10 ) .

B . and C . Molecular models based on the crystal structures previously published [ 44 ] represent configurations of two dimers on DNA : B^Sox2^I - Oct4 heterodimer ( B ) and Oct6 - Oct6 homodimer ( C ) . Bar plots of EMSA - derived cooperativity factors B^for^I B^Oct^I - B^Oct^I homodimers on the MORE ( E ) or B^Sox2^I - B^Oct^I heterodimers on the SoxOct element ( F ) are shown B^for^I a panel of six POU proteins . The mean is shown B^with^I standard deviation as error bars ( n≥3 ) and Tukey multiple comparison of means B^was^I used B^for^I assessment of statistical significances ( * * * p < 0 . 001 , * * p < 0 . 01 , * p < 0 . 05 ) . G . Properties of Oct4 and Oct6 homodimers from molecular dynamics ( MD ) simulations . The structural snapshots illustrate Oct6 ( first monomer in orange , second in dark B^blue^I ) and the 3 parameters used : drmsd = the root mean B^square^I deviation of interatomic distances measured B^for^I the backbone of the structured domains ( excluding the linker ) ; θ = the angle describing the kink in helix α4 ( data B^for^I both monomers 1 and 2 are shown ) ; d = the distance between the centers of mass of the 2 helices α5 ; w = the DNA minor groove width in the region between the 2 monomers .

Individual helixes of POU domains are numbered . Colour representation as in Fig . 1B , 1C . B^For^I clarity , the second monomer of Oct4 / Oct6 is shown in dark B^blue^I . 
B . and C . Network of hydrophobic interactions in Oct6 ( B ) and Oct4 ( C ) . The numbers show the minimal interatomic distances ( excluding hydrogens ) between the residues involved calculated from the simulations . In B^blue^I are those distances that change significantly between Oct4 and Oct6 and in B^red^I those unchanged . The shown standard deviations represent a measure B^for^I the variability during the simulations and B^not^I B^for^I the uncertainty in the calculations .

No response to polySia avDP20 B^was^I detectable in the knockout line . Data show mean + / - SEM . * * p < 0 . 01 , * * * p < 0 . 001 , ANOVA followed by Bonferroni . Statistical analysis B^was^I done in relation to the LPS control .  ( B ) Immunohistochemistry analysis of B^RNF114^I in mouse ovary shows that B^RNF114^I B^was^I mainly expressed in the oocytes ( Scale B^bar^I = 100um ) . 
 ( C ) Knockdown efficiency of B^Rnf114^I in the 2 - cell stage embryos derived from B^Rnf114^I siRNA # 1 or siRNA # 2 injected zygotes B^was^I verified by realtime - B^PCR^I and western blotting . B^NC^I indicates negative control injected B^with^I non - silencing siRNA . Three independent experiment replicates were performed B^for^I realtime - B^PCR^I , error bars represent s . e . m . ; * * : P < 0 . 01 , * * * : P < 0 . 01 in unpaired two - tailed t - test . 
 ( D ) B^RNF114^I depletion impaired the early embryonic development . B^Rnf114^I siRNA # 1 or siRNA # 2 injected zygotes were cultured and quantified ( siRNA1 # , n = 120 ; siRNA2 # , n = 128 ; three independent experiments ) ; B^NC^I indicates negative control ( n = 193 ; six independent experiments ) . The error bars represent s . d . , * : P < 0 . 05 , * * : P < 0 . 01 , * * * : P < 0 . 001 in unpaired two - tailed t - test . 
 ( E ) Representative images to show early embryonic development defects . The embryos arrested at two - cell stage are indicated by arrows ( Scale B^bar^I = 100um ) . 
 ( A ) In vitro ubiquitination assay . Purified His - B^RNF114^I B^was^I subjected to ubiquitination assays B^with^I the indicated components and the samples were analyzed by immunoblotting B^with^I anti - FLAG ( Ub ) antibody . Lanes 1 - 4 indicate negative controls . The results show that recombinant B^RNF114^I efficiently catalyzed the formation of polyubiquitin chains . 
 ( B , C ) Purified wild - type and B^RING^I mutated His - B^RNF114^I were stained by Coomassie Blue ( B ) . Purified wild - type and B^RING^I mutated His - B^RNF114^I were subjected to ubiquitination assays together B^with^I B^E1^I , B^Ubc4^I , FLAG - Ub , and ATP . The results show that mutant B^RNF114^I lacked ubiquitination activity ( C ) . 
 ( D ) Screening B^for^I proteins ubiquitinated by B^RNF114^I on a proteome array . Putative substrates of B^RNF114^I were identified on B^Ubiquitin^I Ligase Substrate Identification on ProtoArray® Human Protein Microarrays v5 . 0 . Ubiquitination reactions were performed on quintuplicate arrays using the indicated components , the five B^sub^I - array are respectively negative controls , B^E1^I + B^E2^I ( no B^E3^I ) , WT B^RNF114^I ( two arrays , duplicate ) , and mutated B^RNF114^I . 
 ( E ) A heat B^map^I comparing hits between B^E1^I + B^E2^I , B^E1^I + B^E2^I + WT B^RNF114^I , and B^E1^I + B^E2^I + mutated B^RNF114^I reactions . Candidate substrates of B^RNF114^I selected B^for^I further characterization are indicated in B^red^I font ; B^HIP1^I , indicated by B^blue^I font , B^was^I considered to be a false positive because it B^was^I also detected in the mutated B^RNF114^I reaction . Black font indicates proteins B^with^I ubiquitin - binding domains such as UIM , B^UBA^I or CUE or proteins without clearly reported functions , which were excluded from further investigation . 
 ( A ) B^RNF114^I substrate validation . HEK293 cells were co - transfected B^with^I constructs expressing FLAG - tagged substrates , wild - type or mutated His - B^RNF114^I and EGFP , and western B^blot^I B^was^I performed B^with^I anti - FLAG and anti - His antibodies . The results show that the protein levels of B^CD74^I , TAB1 , B^OPTN^I , B^TNIP1^I , B^APPL1^I , B^PSAT1^I , and B^RALGPS1^I were reduced in the presence of wild - type B^RNF114^I compared to co - transfecting B^with^I mutant B^RNF114^I . 
 ( B ) B^RNF114^I - dependent in vitro ubiquitination of substrates . Substrate ubiquitination assays were performed B^with^I purified B^RNF114^I , the reaction products were immunoblotted using anti - His antibody to detect the ubiquitin ( upper panel ) or anti - FLAG antibody detecting the substrate protein ( middle panel ) , and the lower panel showed the merged signals . The results show that clear polyubiquitin chains were formed in the systems containing recombinant B^CD74^I , TAB1 , B^TNIP1^I , B^PSAT1^I or B^RALGPS1^I . 
 ( A ) Mouse zygotes were microinjected B^with^I sterile ddH2O ( control group ) or B^Ralgps1^I , B^Cd74^I , B^Tnip1^I , B^Psat1^I , or B^Tab1^I mRNA . During 96 - 100 h culturing , the percentages of embryos at various stages were counted under microscopy . The results show that overexpression of B^Tab1^I impaired the early embryonic development . Three independent experiment replicates were performed , error bars represent s . d . ; * : P < 0 . 05 , * * * : P < 0 . 001 in unpaired two - tailed t - test . 
 ( B ) B^TAB1^I reduced B^with^I mouse early embryonic development , while abnormally accumulated at 2 - cell stage once treated B^with^I B^Rnf114^I siRNAs . B^TAB1^I B^was^I detected by western blotting B^with^I anti - B^TAB1^I antibody . The relative level of B^TAB1^I protein after B^Rnf114^I siRNAs treatment were presented as mean±s . e . m . ( * : P < 0 . 05 in unpaired two - tailed t - test , four independent experiment replicates ) . 
 ( C ) Detection of endogenous B^TAB1^I ubiquitination at 1 - cell or 2 - cell stages . Endogenous B^TAB1^I proteins were immunoprecipated by anti - B^TAB1^I antibody at either 1 - cell or 2 - cell stages , the immunoprecipates were detected by either anti - B^TAB1^I antibody or anti - ubiquitin antibody . The results show that more Ub chains on B^TAB1^I were detected in the two cell stage embryos than in the zygotes , when the B^TAB1^I proteins were at comparable level . 
 ( D ) B^RNF114^I - dependent B^TAB1^I degradation during early embryo development . ( a - c ) Representive time lapse embryo images were shown B^for^I each treatment . Scale B^bar^I = 20um . Gray traces : B^Tab1^I - GFP fluorescent signals were normalized to the first time point ; Black trace : average signal of all embryos B^for^I each treatment .

The values are expressed as percentages of PI positive cells from the total number of DAPI positive cells . At 7 DIV , the majority of amyloid plaques contain 6E10 and B^TR^I positive dense core surrounded by 6E10 positive B^halo^I of diffuse Aβ . In contrast , at 14 DIV , the majority of amyloid plaques are core - only plaques co - stained B^with^I 6E10 and B^TR^I without detectable 6E10 positive B^halo^I . Cells were treated B^with^I OAQ ( oligomycin , antimycin , Q - VD ) B^for^I indicated times and analyzed by B^FACS^I B^for^I lysosomal - positive mt - mKeima ( 561nm ) . The average of three independent experiments is presented . Representative B^FACS^I data from experiments ( GFP control and AS3 _ 67 ) are shown in the lower panels . Error bars indicate standard deviation . Significance calculation : 2 - way anova of one - way anova . n . s . = B^not^I significant . * * * indicates p - value of 0 . 0001 . 
A . LC3C specific sensor mCh - AS3 _ 67 is recruited to Salmonella ( SFH2 ) escaping SCV . Salmonella SFH2 strain is carrying a GFP - reporter gene activated by availability of glucose - 6 - phosphate in the host ' s cytosol . 
B . Salmonella B^with^I prolonged cytosolic residence and strong activation of the GFP - reporter gene ( green arrow ) are B^not^I recognized by the LC3C specific sensor mCh - AS3 _ 67 . 
C . A subpopulation of hyper proliferative Salmonella in the cytosol is coated B^with^I endogenous LC3C . In contrast , endogenous LC3B is enriched in spots in close proximity to the cytosolic bacteria . 
D . Sensitivity of LC3C specific sensor mCh - AS3 _ 67 is increased upon fusion of B^membrane^I - tethering FYVE domain or B^PB1^I oligomerization domain . 
E . Introduction of the B^PB1^I domain to mCh - AS3 _ B^p62^I increases its performance in recognizing endogenous LC3B . 
F . High - performance sensor mCh - B^PB1^I - AS3 _ 67 B^was^I transiently expressed in Salmonella infected HeLa cells to monitor xenophagy events . 
A , B . LC3C specific sensor mCh - B^PB1^I - AS3 _ 67 is recruited to a subset of mitochondria undergoing mitophagy . Mitochondria were labeled B^with^I MitoTracker Deep Red ( ThermoFisher ) . U2OS cells were transiently co - transfected B^for^I indicated sensor and mATG8 proteins . Mitophagy B^was^I induced by CCCP treatment over three hours . Lysosomal degradation of mitochondria undergoing mitophagy B^was^I blocked by the addition of BafilomycinA1 ( Baf ) . 
C . Upon depolarization , endogenous LC3C is localized to mitochondria labeled B^with^I mt - mCherry in U2OS cells . An example of rare events B^with^I nearly complete overlap of signals B^for^I endogenous LC3C and mitochondria ( upper panel ) and a representative image ( lower panel ) is given . 
D . Overlap of LC3C specific sensor signal B^with^I endogenous LC3C and endogenous B^LAMP1^I in U2OS cells induced B^for^I mitophagy .
